Summary




Versar is currently seeking an experienced data engineer/data scientist who will work within the organization to provide advanced data-driven solutions, business insights and support decisions. As a data scientist/data engineer, you will have a sound knowledge and experience Statistical Models, Data Mining, Machine Learning, building analytical solutions to deliver insights, insights communication and presentation, as well as demonstrating the ability to combine advanced analytics skills with exceptional business acumen. In addition, you will be key to the success of the department’s goal of creating a reliable foundation for ongoing reporting and analytics. This is a position that is located in Washington, DC, with limited remote opportunities. Duties/Responsibilities:




Lead and support analytical projects by providing Statistical expertise in study design, statistic modeling, data analysis, outcome interpretation and communication.




Ability to utilize extensive experience and skills in Java Script with Vector Graphics and/or DAX PowerBI to translate data into focused and targeted information to provide analytical solutions that provides actionable recommendations to drive the success of the key initiatives.




Ability to apply statistics knowledge, develop analytics solutions (descriptive, inferencing, predictive, and prescriptive), and derive insights to support business decisions, and proactively come up with ideas to explore and uncover new findings and improve process efficiency.




Provides technical development expertise for designing, coding, testing, debugging, documenting, and supporting all types of analytical products consistent with the established specifications and business requirements in order to deliver business value.




Develop a deep understanding of the key initiative of the organization, and be able Participates in development of standards, design and implementation of proactive processes to collect and report data and statistics on assigned systems.




Communicate analytical findings and recommendations in a clear and concise way to non-technical audiences, both in oral and written presentations.




Work closely with Information Management teams to automate recurring tasks and improve processes to continually increase efficiency




Requirements




Experience




5+ years of experience of leveraging advanced analytics to drive business decisions




Strong background in Statistic modeling and development of analytics solution based on business needs




Education/Skills




Educational background in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering is required




Extensive demonstrated experience with Java Script with 1) Vector Graphic and/or 2) DAX PowerBI Proficiency with programming languages, automation tools and stats packages (e.g. R, python, SAS, hive)is required




Sound knowledge and experience in Statistical Models and Data Mining is required




Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks etc.is required




Must demonstrate exceptional analytical skills with business acumen




Must have communication skills and the ability to develop and present solutions to all levels of management (including executive levels)




Must have demonstrated the ability to solve complex problems with minimal direction Must be able to interact effectively and patiently with customers especially while under pressure




Must exhibit an ability to multitask to meet objectives and deadlines




Ability to establish and maintain positive working relationships with other employees




Behavioral Competencies Action oriented- Taking on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm.




Customer focus- Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions.




Communicates effectively- Developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences.




Decision quality- Making good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward.




Collaborates- Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives.




Nimble learning- Actively learning through experimentation when tackling new problems, using both successes and failures as learning fodder.




Demonstrates self-awareness- Using a combination of feedback and reflection to gain productive insight into personal strengths and weaknesses.

Summary This position is located in the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Office of Oceanic and Atmospheric Research (OAR), Climate Program Office (CPO), with one vacancy in Silver Spring, MD. This position is also announced under vacancy number OAR CPO-23-11851618-ST, which is open to Status Candidates. You must apply to both announcements if you want to be considered for both. Responsibilities As a Data Scientist, you will perform the following duties: Identify the methods, processes, algorithms, tools, and systems to extract and interpret findings from varied structured and unstructured data sets related to the data science lifecycle. Utilize data visualization techniques to articulate findings while applying professional knowledge of computer science and mathematical and statistical theories, techniques, and methods to gather, analyze, design, and construct new processes. Lead and manage activities focused on improving climate and health (principally heat-health) user decision-making and service provision, research transition, and integration of climate and health data and information. Oversee efforts across NOAA Line Offices, Laboratories, and Programs to improve operational service provision, research transition, and integration of climate and health data. These duties are described at the full performance level of the ZP-4; the ZP-3 is developmental leading to such performance. Summary




The Data Services Analyst is responsible for internal data-related requests that include ad hoc reports, letter campaign data scrubs and processing, pipeline reports and troubleshooting data-related issues in the systems of record.




Essential Functions




Create and maintain pipeline report that projects company’s cash flow
Understand company’s business model and database structure in order to use Microsoft SQL to extract data from database and generate ad-hoc reports for upper management
Support company’s business objectives by using Microsoft SQL to perform Data Mining in order to achieve the best effectiveness of letter campaigns
Understand company’s letter outsourcing process and help manage the workflow of letter generation such as billing statements
Learn loan’s terms and conditions, including mortgage and consumer loans, as well as database structures of all systems in order to align the two in the best way possible to trouble shoot erroneous data points
Understand company’s systems of record and data structure in order to onboard accounts received from clients




Qualifications And Skills




Bachelor’s Degree with minimum GPA of 3.0 required
1-2 years of SQL experience required and related work experience highly preferred
Must be able to pass a criminal background check, drug screen and credit check to client required standards
Must be able to work with little direction; self-motivated
Ability to communicate effectively and concisely, verbally and in writing
Must be a team player with initiative and committed to working in a quality environment
Ability to achieve objectives with minimal supervision; detailed-oriented
Basic knowledge of all components of MS SQL server database software
Basic knowledge of Crystal Report and Finance is a plus

Title: Sr. Data Analyst

Location: Remote

Type: Contract

Role is 75% Data Analyst and 25% QA

Require

A minimum of 5-7 years' experience in software development, data management.

Demonstrated experience with AWS Lambda, SNS/SQS, S3, IAM, CloudWatch, RDS, DynamoDB, and Athena.

Experience working in a NodeJS based environment

Develop and participate in the review of requirements, data mappings, use cases and other artifacts and clearly communicate to both the business and technical team members the system requirements.

Demonstrate the ability to access data, analyze data, and remediate data issues leveraging SQL and applicable AWS analytics tools such as Athena.

Support ad hoc data requests as required as part of DevOps team.

Ability to understand business needs and translate them into technical specifications.

Experience with E2E browser testing and automated API integration testing

Experience developing testing strategies and identifying comprehensive test scenarios based on business requirements.

Experience analyzing user stories and creating integration, system, and acceptance test cases

Job Posting




General Description Of Position




The Data Scientist is responsible for supporting data science initiatives that drive business profitability, increased efficiencies and improved customer experience. This role applies industry-leading analytical methodologies for working with large datasets to extract meaningful business insight and creatively solve business problems. Data Scientists are also responsible for ensuring that developed codes are documented into a library of reusable algorithms.




As a Data Scientist, you will apply advanced analytics methods and algorithms for identifying trends and providing business solutions. This role is expected to present insights and recommendations to non-technical audiences and explain the benefits and impacts of the recommended solutions. In addition, Data Scientists collaborate with business partners and cross-functional teams, requiring effective communication skills, building relationships, and focus on understanding the overall business area being supported.




This role will facilitate the end-to-end development, testing, and monitoring of analytical models across our brands. The Data Scientist will use machine learning and algorithms in an effort to improve data quality and generate insights from the data. The role will be very hands-on and focused in AI/ML model development. This scientist will attend daily standups and work in an Agile environment.




Essential Duties And Responsibilities




Design and develop algorithms and models to use against large datasets to create business insights
Participate in analytical projects as a data science/technical lead
May work independently in a solution environment
Aid in the appropriate selection, utilization and interpretation of advanced analytical methodologies
Execute tasks with high levels of efficiency and quality
Effectively communicate insights and recommendations to both technical and non-technical leaders and business customers/partners including preparing reports, updates and/or presentations related to progress made on a project or solution
Work with project teams and business partners to determine project goals and deliver productionized models and tools using Agile (including data processing, scripting, modeling, measurement, error handling, and documentation)
Present recommendations in a confident manner in order to influence execution of recommendation
Incorporate business knowledge into solution approachIdentify relevant data sources to mine given target outcomes
Collect large structured and unstructured datasets and variables
Analyze data for trends and patterns, and interpret data with a clear objective in mind
Effectively develop trust and collaboration with internal customers and cross-functional teams
Work with project teams and business partners to determine project goals
Participate in the continuous improvement of analytics by developing replicable solutions (e.g., codified data products, project documentation, flowcharts) to ensure solutions are leveraged for future projects
Utilizing statistical techniques to identify key insights that help solve business problems including mastery in predictive modeling, data mining and data analysis
Perform any other related duties as required or assigned.




Qualifications




To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty mentioned satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.




Education And Experience




Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field like Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, Science, or Mathematics. 1 to 3 years of related experience in data mining and analytics, database structure and ETL, predictive modeling, machine learning, and statistical programming languages.

Overview




A Data Analytics Support Specialist seeks out and defines data from various sources and assists the Data Analytics Team with interpreting data, mapping data sources and assists in turning data into information which can offer ways to improve a business, thus affecting business decisions. The Data Analytics Support Specialist gathers information from various sources via various tools and methods and helps interpret patterns and trends. Once data has been gathered and interpreted, the Data Analytics Support Specialist will report back what has been found in a comprehensive study to the wider business/relevant colleagues via various published formats of reports or filters on existing reports.




This is a full-time (Monday - Friday) On-Site position that is located at our HQ office in Columbus OH.

Job Summary




The Business Analyst will work with the Vice President of Finance to support sales planning and analysis and controlling ad hoc assignments. Essential Job Functions




Track and analyze key metrics
Collect, consolidate, and generate weekly sales forecasts
Coordinate, prepare and present annual and 5-years sales budget

Proactively analyze win-loss data and report on key findings

Retrieve and analyze sales and financial information from SAP
Prepare various business cases to support capital investment decisions
Prepare business unit and/or customer profitability reports
Prepare cost / benefit analysis
Modeling techniques and methods
General financial analysis assignments, particularly in the areas of customer and product profitability.
Presentation material preparations.

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Business, Marketing or related degree.




Experience




3-plus years in a Business Analyst or similar role

Strong quantitate and qualitative analytical abilities.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Advanced computer skills including Excel & PowerPoint are required
SAP experience is a plus

Excellent problem-solving skills
Ability to work well with others
Ability to be a self-starter

Job Description

Cintas is seeking a Data Analyst. The Data Analyst aggregates and performs statistical analysis on business data based on requests from project teams or senior leadership. Influences key decisions through data analysis and offers recommendations to senior leadership teams. Integrates data from multiple data sources or functional areas, ensure data accuracy and integrity, and updates data as needed. Writes queries or reports to provide data for various analytical projects. Interprets data to identify business trends, conduct root cause analysis of business problems, or suggest areas for process improvements. Develops and delivers presentations. May develop and implement data collection systems and strategies, program and build solutions (e.g. apps, software), and work with qualitative data. Develops end user training on new or revised procedures for the BI solution, processes, and /or systems. Act as a liaison between business teams and IT to identify any gaps in infrastructure based on business requirements gathered.

Required

Strong critical thinking skills, detail oriented, and logical approach to solving problems

Proficiency with Microsoft Office, especially Excel advanced features and functions
Ability to work in a team, with technical and non-technical personnel, and across functional areas

Preferred

Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in Supply Chain, Data Analytics, Math, Economics, Statistics
Knowledge of Sourcing, Planning, Inventory, and Supply Chain operations
Experience with SAP ERP and SAP Business Objects tools
Working knowledge of a programming language and ability to learn new languages as required.
3+ years of experience using data analytics, statistics, and predictive modeling to solve business problems

Enter data accurately and efficiently into the company's database system.
Verify data for accuracy and completeness.
Maintain confidentiality of sensitive data and adhere to data entry and security policies.
Ensure data entry procedures are followed correctly.
Identify and resolve any data entry errors or discrepancies.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, especially Excel and Word.
Ability to maintain confidentiality and adhere to data entry and security policies.
Flexibility to work various shifts and overtime as needed.
No prior experience required.

This is a remote position that requires a reliable internet connection and a quiet workspace. The Data Entry Clerk Specialist, Data Entry Administrative, will need to be able to work independently and manage their time effectively to complete tasks on time. Salary

The starting salary for this position will depend on experience and qualifications. This is an entry-level position, and no prior experience is required.

Job Title: Data Analyst (Hybrid)




Location: Indianapolis, IN




Duration: 6+ Months




Job Type: Corp-Corp / 1099 / Contract W2




Rate: 32/hr. on C2C




Client: State of Indiana




Interview Type: Both Webcam & In Person




Note: Candidate MUST be Local to Indiana




Job Description




Reports to the Trauma System Epidemiologist, IDOH Division of Trauma and Injury Prevention. The incumbent seeks to improve trauma care across the spectrum of trauma system activities by focusing on all aspects of the statewide trauma data collection and analysis, and specifically by directing data provided by ARIES and EMS to perform analyses and record linkage. The analyst will be working and communicating/coordinating with ARIES, EMS, and the IT staff to ensure data transfers and linkages are successful with the trauma registry. The incumbent will prepare data using subject matter expertise with Tableau and other statistical softwares. They will then perform analyses on the data and present findings to stakeholders through public dissemination and dashboard development.




Duties And Responsibilities




Queries and analyzes trauma registry, ARIES/crash, and EMS data for data requests as necessary, in conjunction with the Data Release Committee;




Coordinates data analysis projects with multiple stakeholders based on grant deliverables, specifically the interfacing and linkage/analysis of data to provide information on patient outcomes for crash survivors;




Works to integrate ARIES and EMS data with the State Trauma Registry through probabilistic data linking and statistical modeling;




Prepares monthly reports and annual progress reports for submission to the granting agency and trauma stakeholders as necessary;




Presents trauma data analysis reports and trauma registry data analysis procedures at conferences and meetings where needed;




Performs and documents procedures for data preparation including record linkage, data cleaning, standardization, analysis and interpretation;




Works with Trauma System Epidemiologist to improve quality, accuracy and timeliness of data submitted to the Registry;




Applies principles of good ethical, legal, and public health practice as they relate to data reports, design and data collection, dissemination and use;




Works with the Trauma System Epidemiologist to assist independent researchers to mine Registry data while ensuring patient confidentiality is maintained as necessary;




Provides operational support for the database to the Division, ensuring data integrity, database availability, and performance;




Develops integration of database systems through standardized database design techniques;




Develops data collection and evaluation methodologies, including format design, project criteria and requirements, data compilation, relevancy and usage;




Incorporates interpersonal skills in communication with agency personnel, colleagues, and the public;




Collaborates with trauma stakeholders including the Indiana State Trauma Care Committee and Performance Improvement Subcommittee for best practices in data analysis and effective data reporting;




Prepares quarterly rehabilitation reports for performance improvement efforts;




Some travel may be required;




Performs related duties as assigned.




Difficulty Of Work




Incumbent uses judgment in selecting the guidelines to follow, but also relies on the direction of the Trauma System Epidemiologist. Work is broad in scope and requires in-depth analysis of multiple variables to fit various circumstances of a medium to complex enterprise-wide system.




Responsibility




Incumbent exercises professional judgment in situations requiring sensitivity and/or confidentiality. Incumbent works closely with higher-level staff and/or management to outline general objectives and boundaries that incumbent will follow to meet the requirements of the agency. Unusual problems or deviations from guidelines or practice are discussed with the Trauma System Epidemiologist and Trauma and Injury Prevention Program Director.




General goals, objectives and problems affecting agency policy and practices are discussed with superiors, but incumbent utilizes own initiative in performing and data analysis of the Indiana Trauma Registry and other data sets. General methodology and handling of procedures are at the discretion of the incumbent. His/ her work is reviewed by superiors concerned for compliance with policy and agency program goals.




Personal Work Relationships




Incumbent works primarily with personnel from within the agency, including division staff, other state agency staff, EMS providers, hospital employees and others for the purpose of analyzing trauma registry data. Contacts are for the purpose of informing, gathering information and interpreting that information to arrive at appropriate solutions, provide technical expertise and coordinate workflow. Contacts can involve persuading and negotiating to accomplish mission while maintaining good client relations.

FinPro, a dynamic and growing financial institution advisory and investment banking firm, located in downtown Somerville, New Jersey, is seeking qualified candidates for a Senior Associate position in our fast-paced environment committed to delivering the highest level of service and analytics to our clients.




While maintaining our strong position in the financial institution advisory space, we are expanding our use of advanced data analytics and detailed modeling to deliver our core service lines of strategic planning, asset liability management, enterprise risk management, regulatory advisory and management advisory services, corporate governance, capital markets and data analytics.




Successful candidates will become part of a dynamic team of consultants and will be heavily involved in the preparation and delivery of advisory services to our clients. Our intermediate size and hands on culture offers unique opportunities for the successful candidate to be actively involved in all aspects of the advisory business, including building financial models, becoming a subject matter expert, and developing and enhancing consulting services and deliverables. We are looking for innovative thinkers who like to challenge the status quo and apply new analytical techniques to solving quantitative problems. In this unique opportunity, your upward mobility is only limited by your drive, motivation and ambition.




Qualified candidates will possess the following skills and competencies:

· Bachelor’s degree

· 2 to 3 years of experience in an analytical role

· Passion for solving problems with financial models and analytics solutions

· Intellectual curiosity to constantly learn and always improve on our services, models, analytics and deliverables

· Proven track record of building and running financial models with expert knowledge of Power BI, Excel and PowerPoint

· Willingness to learn and present ideas and concepts to our clients

· Strong analytical, conceptual and organizational skills with the demonstrated ability to manage numerous activities and initiatives effectively in a fast-paced work environment

· Strong time management skills including the ability to multitask and properly/continuously re-prioritize multiple tasks with tight timelines

· Self-driven and proactive in taking new initiatives and carrying them through to completion

· Ability to work both independently and effectively within a team framework with both senior level and support level positions.

· Demonstrated ability to present and articulate strategic concepts to senior management level and the Board of Directors

· Demonstrated leadership and training skills with a drive to constantly improve processes and deliverables

· Ability to make difficult decisions quickly with limited information or understand when and why a decision cannot be made

· Accuracy and attention to detail

· Fluent in English, both verbal and written




Responsibilities include:

· Work with managing directors in executing client consulting engagements from start to finish, including running financial models and production of output, developing custom analytics and responsibility for special projects

· Interaction with Client CEO’s and Board of Directors

· Attend and participate in client meetings

· Build and improve our internal analytical models and develop our client facing analytics

· Identify and define opportunities to improve our processes for enhanced efficiency

· Run financial models, produce output and identify the need for custom analytics where appropriate

· Evaluating and integrating data from internal and external sources to support modeling, analytics and reporting

· Proactively using data to generate useful insights by assessing key performance indicators or other trends for our clients

· Build out client reports

· Direct service line responsibility for at least one area

· Conduct industry research that will be utilized in analyses, presentations and papers

· Constantly grow industry knowledge




The firm offers a competitive base salary with annual bonus which is correlated to both individual and corporate performance. FinPro provides a comprehensive benefits package that includes paid vacation, health insurance (including family), dental and vision insurance, and life and disability insurance. FinPro matches up to 4% for 401k with the option of providing profit sharing levels above that based upon performance. In addition, we will ensure continued on-the-job educational support and training coupled with a strong mentorship program. We value long-term stability and career progression. For more information about the company, please visit our website at www.finpro.us.

The firm offers a competitive base salary with annual bonus which is correlated to both individual and corporate performance. FinPro provides a comprehensive benefits package that includes paid vacation, health insurance (including family), dental and vision insurance, and life and disability insurance. FinPro matches up to 4% for 401k with the option of providing profit sharing levels above that based upon performance. In addition, we will ensure continued on-the-job educational support and training coupled with a strong mentorship program. We value long-term stability and career progression. For more information about the company, please visit our website at www.finpro.us.

Job Description

Who we are:

Born digital, UST transforms lives through the power of technology. We walk alongside our clients and partners, embedding innovation and agility into everything they do. We help them create transformative experiences and human-centered solutions for a better world.

UST is a mission-driven group of over 38,000+ practical problem solvers and creative thinkers in over 30+ countries. Our entrepreneurial teams are empowered to innovate, act nimbly, and create a lasting and sustainable impact for our clients, their customers, and the communities in which we live.

With us, you’ll create a boundless impact that transforms your career—and the lives of people across the world.

Visit us at UST.com .

You Are

A highly energetic and collaborative Data Analyst with experience in Python, SQL and a good understanding of statistics, data structures and data models.

The Opportunity

You will work with sales and business development teams in identifying data analysis requirements, participate in technical discussions with IT and business when building new solutions and migrating existing analytic workloads to AWS.

The Role

Conduct full technical discovery, identify pain points, business, and technical requirements, as-is and to-be scenarios.
Lead discussions and early analysis and proof of concepts, as it relates to a client’s data analysis requirements.
Help the client in use case development and prioritization as well as transitioning these concepts from ideas to proof-of-concepts all the way to production delivery.
Compare solution alternatives across, costs, technical and business parameters
Apply UST’s methodology, products, accelerators and reusable assets, and previous work experience to deliver consistently high-quality work.

What You Need

At least 3 years of experience as a data analyst designing and developing visually compelling data narratives.
Experience architecting, engineering, and maintaining solutions on the public cloud ecosystem.
Must be a hands-on technologist capable of developing proof-of-concepts and demoing reports.
Excellent understanding of key data concepts
Ability to design and develop data visualizations and define stories using Python and SQL.
Experience with the public cloud ecosystem, particularly AWS is a must have.
Fluent with Python and have experience with SQL and a good understanding of Machine Learning
Experience working with AWS Services.
Bachelors Degree or equivalent experience
Must be able to travel at least 25%.

Bonus Points If

You possess previous experience in a pre-sales or sales support capacity.

Compensation can differ depending on factors including but not limited to the specific office location, role, skill set, education, and level of experience. As required by local law, UST provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in California, Colorado, New York City, or Washington as set forth below.

Role Location: Remote

Compensation Range: $72,000 to $108,000

What We Believe

We’re proud to embrace the same values that have shaped UST since the beginning. Since day one, we’ve been building enduring relationships and a culture of integrity. And today, it's those same values that are inspiring us to encourage innovation from everyone, to champion diversity and inclusion, and to place people at the center of everything we do.

Humility

We will listen, learn, be empathetic and help selflessly in our interactions with everyone.

Humanity

Through business, we will better the lives of those less fortunate than ourselves.

Integrity

We honor our commitments and act with responsibility in all our relationships.

Job Title: Junior Digital Marketing Manager

Employer: GoDigital Media Group (godigitalmg.com)

Classification: Full-Time, Exempt

Reports to: Marketing Director

Location: United States




About the Company:

At YogaWorks, we believe yoga is for everyone and it is our mission to inspire happiness by connecting people through mindful movement. YogaWorks is the most trusted and experienced provider of quality yoga instruction forstudents of all levels and ages. Our expertly trained, passionate teachers make yoga and mindful movement practices accessible to people all over the word. The first YogaWorks studio opened over 35 years ago and we now operate internationally as an online digital yoga studio.




About the role:

This marketing team member will help oversee marketing projects, driving precise results that benefit the entire organization. This role will assist with email and social media marketing, partnerships, and paid media, working closely with product development, brand development, and design teams.




Working with the Director of Marketing, you will be empowered to strategize, plan, develop, and implement new marketing strategies and approaches. The ideal candidate for this role will be a creative, collaborative marketing and communications professional with experience in brand management, campaign design and execution, and measurement. This candidate is expected to develop and implement our strategy and content to increase our online presence and improve our marketing and sales efforts, including customer retention and acquisition. Above all, this person must be agile, open, and have a team-centric mindset.




Primary Responsibilities:

Develop, implement, and manage social media strategy for each relevant platform: Instagram, Tiktok, Facebook, LinkedIn, and Twitter.
Develop with Marketing Director an innovative content calendar to express brand personality, key brand priorities, and emerging trend moments.
Measure the success of every social media campaign to include daily pivots as required to ensure maximum reach and engagement.
Prepare brand-relevant copy for social posts, emails, and paid media, and work with designers to ensure content is informative, current, and on brand point.
Assist in the creation of consumer-facing assets for advertising and marketing messaging.
Provide timely and consistent communication of brand activity and key information to internal business partners.
Manage email and social marketing: strategy, calendaring, implementation, execution, optimization, monitoring, reporting, and analysis to increase revenue.
Drive A/B testing including design, KPI definition, implementation, and measurement.
Effectively manage email service provider platforms, such as MailChimp. Within the platform you will be segmenting audiences, setting up A/B tests, and serving as a final quality assurance check before campaigns are launched
Creating scalable processes ensuring best practices in lead generation, reporting, and analytics.
Present results and recommendations to Marketing Director regularly.
Work with other business departments including designers, product, and programming.
Continually optimize subject lines, email content, and audiences to maximize open rates, click rates, and conversion rates.
Co-develop and manage integrated partner marketing strategies and plans with a set of strategic partners.




Experience and Qualification

BA degree in Marketing or a relevant field
4-5+ years of experience in marketing or content strategy or a similar role
Experience using social media for brand awareness and impressions
Excellent knowledge of Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram, and other social media emerging platforms
Proven track record of creating, implementing, and optimizing complex email programs to meet business goals
Strong project management skills with the ability to monitor multiple projects simultaneously and overcome obstacles
Strong copywriter knowledge with the ability to adapt voice and tone
Ability to work independently as well as build effective working relationships with cross-functional teams
Impeccable attention to detail, deadlines, and accuracy with minimum supervision
Ability to interpret and analyze data from multiple sources and uncover actionable insight
Experience with doing audience and buyer persona research
Excellent multitasking skills and time-management skills
Critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Strong team player and work well in cross-company channels
Demonstrate a strong passion for storytelling
Can effectively work in a fast-changing environment and quickly act on decisions.




Benefits

Medical / Dental / Vision
Flexible Spending Account (FSA)
Health Savings Account (HSA)
Life, AD&D and Disability Insurance
401(k) Plan & Employer Match
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Additional Employee Benefits & Perks (i.e. YogaWorks subscription, Access Perks)




Physical Requirements

Able to perform and demonstrate exercises and postures relevant to class style(s).
Physically able to lift and carry 1-10 lb. equipment.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include Close vision, Distance vision, Peripheral vision, Depth perception and Ability to adjust and focus.
Adjust and operate equipment.
Strong verbal skills (proficient in speaking and understanding English)
Must be able to effectively hear in person and via telephone.




Additional Information:

Yogaworks is a GoDigital Media Group company that is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of our community. We are an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability status.

Role : Data Engineer




Location : Austin, TX / Sunnyvale, CA (- Onsite Hybrid )




Jd




Client is looking for Sr Data Engineer with Python, SQL and need cloud in AWS or GCP




provided by Dice

Employee Applicant Privacy Notice

Who we are:

Shape a brighter financial future with us.

Together with our members, we’re changing the way people think about and interact with personal finance.

We’re a next-generation fintech company using innovative, mobile-first technology to help our millions of members reach their goals. The industry is going through an unprecedented transformation, and we’re at the forefront. We’re proud to come to work every day knowing that what we do has a direct impact on people’s lives, with our core values guiding us every step of the way. Join us to invest in yourself, your career, and the financial world.

The role

The Operations - PMO leads the development and implementation of the Operations strategic roadmap as well as designing, planning, coordination and the implementation for all operational impacting projects (programs, policy, products, tools and technology) to ensure Member Engagement teams are equipped with the most efficient tools, technology and processes to best serve our Members. As a champion of change, the PMO team is focused on delivering on the Member experience and unit economic goals in partnership with key stakeholders in EPD, Marketing and within the operations organization.

What you’ll do:


Builds and leads the execution of the Operations Strategic roadmap to build innovative and efficient operations solutions.
Leads a team of Project Managers supporting the various Business Unit operating heads and functions.
Responsible for maintaining the project portfolio funnel, initiating new projects aligned to business priorities and long-term strategy.
Partners and collaborates with functional leaders in all functional areas to deliver products and services from concept to full launch ensuring operational readiness including process, reporting, technology, risk and compliance.
Drives internal and external direction, timing and collaboration with subject matter experts, end-users, member teams and supporting validation and co-creation.
Accountable for identifying business needs and use cases, developing solution strategies, and managing prioritization in partnership with EPD of operations impacting initiatives.
Manage operationalizing, and communicating program plans, status and impacts across operations (Tech Ops) and with the EPD and Business Unit partners..
Identifies and solves for evolving gaps and emerging needs in project management skills, process capabilities, and capacity to support sustained long-term business growth.
Works across organizational boundaries leading teams in building trust, collaboration, and breaking down barriers.
Manage project risks, develop mitigation plans and resolve problems impacting project completion, proactively resolving project issues and escalating to management when necessary.


What you’ll need:


Experience as a proven leader with a vision to optimize the operations processes and toolsets to deliver best in class member service with efficiency and ease.
Experience as a detailed oriented strategic thinker who is capable of building and leading an enterprise Project Management Office (PMO).
Delivery of high-quality deliverables that power member satisfaction, meet business requirements to ensure consistent methods and tools are deployed across the enterprise.
Ability to build, contribute and execute scalable processes and systems enabling consistent project management practices to ensure operational efficiencies, adherence to policy and procedures, regulatory compliance, improved member experience while delivering on unit economic goals.
Data-driven skills, excellent organizational talents, and the ability to clearly articulate and present information for stakeholders at all levels of the business.
8-10 years’ experience in a director or leadership operational role
5-7 year’s project management experience, with some experience in financial services
Able to navigate multiple unique business functions successfully
Must be able to effectively network and build partnerships in a fast-paced environment
Ability to react to change quickly and implement new processes & procedures
Ability to work independently with little or no supervision
Professional demeanor and excellent work habits are essential


Compensation And Benefits

The base pay range for this role is listed below. Final base pay offer will be determined based on individual factors such as the candidate’s experience, skills, and location.

To view all of our comprehensive and competitive benefits, visit our Benefits at SoFi page!

SoFi provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion (including religious dress and grooming practices), sex (including pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, breastfeeding, and conditions related to breastfeeding), gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, age (40 or over), physical or medical disability, medical condition, marital status, registered domestic partner status, sexual orientation, genetic information, military and/or veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by applicable state or federal law.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

SoFi is committed to embracing diversity. As part of this commitment, SoFi offers reasonable accommodations to candidates with physical or mental disabilities. If you need accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, please let your recruiter know or email accommodations@sofi.com.

Due to insurance coverage issues, we are unable to accommodate remote work from Hawaii or Alaska at this time.

Job Title: Marketing Analytics Specialist
Location: Austin, TX - Hybrid
Duration: 5 months contract with possibility of extension
Pay Range: $39 to $44 on W2 with benefits

Job Summary
We are seeking an eCommerce Analytics Specialist to ideate, define, analyze, and optimize site analytics and KPIs for direct-to-consumer mobile, tablet and desktop digital experiences across global set of small-and-medium partners.

This analytics specialist role will focus on both end customer experiences across different eCommerce platforms and merchant tools working with services, digital content, or analytics. This candidate will work with large external agencies, engineering teams, global sales teams, UX designers, and various other cross-functional partners to propose, formulate, and deliver key insights to help improve the customer experience resulting in improved KPIs.

Candidates with strong experience with Google Analytics setup, reporting, custom event creation, and custom reporting are ideal. Candidates who also have knowledge and experience working with business partners in identifying optimization opportunities in the buy funnel of an ecommerce site.

Key Responsibilities
Own the reporting and setup for analytics for our Partner sites
Leverage Google Analytics Universal and GA4 to analyze KPIs for optimization opportunities
Create insights based on data to optimize the buy-flow and site structure
Work with large agencies and system integrators to implement, maintain integrations with GA4
Develop key metrics/reports to measure and continually optimize the partner eCommerce sites
Be abreast on market trends and new technology capabilities regarding ecommerce analytics to evaluate and recommend solutions
Be abreast of GA4 features and improvements.

Key Requirements
Experience in ecommerce digital marketing
Experience with Google Analytics Universal (required)
Experience with Google Analytics 4 (required)
Experience with A/B testing and other testing metrics
2+ years experience in data crunching from top-tier consulting, investment banking, private equity or strategy/business for a fast-growing global tech company
Ability to move fast and be efficient, making decisions on objective evidence rather than subjective gut feel
Innate desire to take ownership, make an impact and influence outcomes
Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to work independently
Drive Decision-Making: Use coding, analytics, and advanced modeling to understand project success, areas of opportunity, and make informed, strategic business decisions.
Leverage Advanced Analytics to optimize marketing, sales performance, and make continuous improvements to the program.
2+ years experience in a data-driven analytics or strategy role
Experience building models, forecasts, budgets and dynamic reports with SQL, Tableau and Excel that provide meaningful direction and insight
Skills that foster collaboration and team spirit
Experience with data visualization and presentation (Tableau, Microsoft BI, or similar software)
Experience preparing and delivering presentations tailored for a specific audience
Experience setting, managing and reporting against multi-year plans, budgets, KPIs, milestones, roadmaps, etc.
Excellent written, presentation and oral communication skills
Action-oriented and enjoy working in a fast paced, dynamic environment

Education
Bachelors Degree

Other requirements
Shopify Site administration (nice to have)
Adobe Analytics (nice to have)
Must to have skills - Python,Pandas,Data Analysis,Tableau

Consultant – Financial Data Analyst



Immediate Opportunity. YES. WE ARE HIRING NOW!



Do you have exceptional data, analytical and math skills? Do you have great finance, forecasting, or budgeting experience? Are you an excellent consultant, problem solver, communicator, and storyteller? Are you interested in joining a boutique consulting firm that drives innovation, acceleration, and benefits realization for our Fortune 100 clients? Are you interested in working closely with senior-level management, upping your skills, and accelerating your career in Consulting, Data Analytics & Data Engineering?



WNA is seeking a Consultant Financial Data Analytics with data, financial management, budgeting, or forecasting experience with large organizations for client consulting and project work.



Key Qualifications



Ability to engage with clients and WNA Team Members to assess and align business and technology objectives & operations, and to identify the measures that matter.
Ability or desire to tell a story. Able to consolidate data into meaningful information for management decision-making. Work on projects to identify operational and financial data, trends, scenarios, and challenges to make improvements to processes and results. Develop and analyze budget and forecast data.
Able or willing to learn to translate and map data into Power BI for visualization and reporting. Create automated Power BI dashboards. Develop best Power BI approaches and practices and enhance the skills within the organization. Be a Day 1 go-to organization SME for Power BI.
Exceptional math, spreadsheet, and data analytics skills with incredible attention to detail and accuracy. Excellent presentation development and presentation skills. Expert with MS Suite tools including Power BI, PowerPoint, and Excel.
Highly responsive to customers and team. Ability to work unguided and independently.
Excellent communication skills. Work in teams and one-on-one with senior client management—not just taking direction but advising, guiding, peering, and supporting success. Brings enthusiasm and assertiveness. Tells a compelling visual and verbal story.
1 - 5 years experience working in large company environments in Data Analytics, Data Engineering, operations, IT, and/or financial management.
Bachelor’s degree required. Finance, Business, IT, or Engineering degree preferred. Graduate degree a plus but not required. 1 – 5+ years of post-graduate work experience required.

Competencies and Attributes:



To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following characteristics and competencies that define the culture at WNA:



Leadership – Inspires positive action leading to desired results; Motivates teams, both WNA and client, toward a common goal; Leads by example; Models an economy of effort and achievement; Demonstrates a standard of excellence that creates alignment around business benefits and objectives.



Integrity – Shares principles and values core to WNA, including honesty and teamwork.

Customer Service – Responds promptly to customer needs; Solicits customer feedback to improve sales and service; Responds to requests for service and assistance; Meets commitments; Manages difficult or emotional customer situations.

Teamwork – Balances team and individual responsibilities; Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views; Gives and welcomes feedback; Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Puts success of team above own interests; Able to build morale and group commitments to goals and objectives; Supports everyone's efforts to succeed.

Business Acumen – Understands business implications of decisions; Displays orientation to profitability; Demonstrates knowledge of market and competition; Aligns work with Market Segment goals.

Strategic Thinking – Develops strategies to achieve client business goals; Understands clients strengths & weaknesses; Analyzes market and competition; Identifies clients external threats and opportunities; Adapts solutions to changing conditions.




Innovation – Takes initiative; Displays original thinking and creativity; Meets challenges with resourcefulness; Generates suggestions for solving problems and identifying business needs; Develops innovative approaches and ideas; Presents ideas and information in a manner that gets others' attention and gains trust of the client.

Oral Communication – Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; Influences and negotiates without conflict; Listens and gets clarification; Responds well to questions; Demonstrates executive level conversation and presentation skills, including deft objection handling; Generates excitement and enthusiasm.



Presentation – Develops vivid images and stories to support communications; Incorporates graphics, data and text in a seamless and coherent way to help clearly articulate and summarize client challenges and solutions and WNA’s value proposition. Hands on creation and creativity with presentation development tools including PowerPoint, Excel, Visio and others. Outstanding presentation delivery.



Written Communication – Writes clearly and informatively; Varies writing style to audience; Presents numerical data effectively; Edits work for spelling, grammar, punctuation and overall quality; Able to read, interpret and summarize large volumes of written information.



Analytical – Synthesizes complex or diverse information; Collects and researches data from appropriate sources and applies data science and data analytics; Uses intuition and experience to complement data. Moves along the spectrum from bad data to good data, information, insight, action, impact and results.

Strong References – Has a strong network of references willing to speak to character, integrity and past success.



Locations: Atlanta, Georgia; Dallas, Texas; all other US locations considered.



Compensation: $70,000 – 110,000 per year commensurate with skills and experience. Benefits & bonus potential.



Timing/Duration: Immediate. Accelerate your career with WNA as one of our employee Team Members.



About WNA



WNA is a global Transformation and Technology solutions provider. WNA brings leadership, analytics, solutions, acceleration, integration, change management, risk management, and business results to our clients’ largest, most important, and most complex business and technology challenges. WNA's dynamic environment has excellent opportunities for people who want to join a growing business and provide unsurpassed client service and leadership to some of the top companies in the world. Job_title: Mortgage associate - data entry - Remote | WFH
Job_description: Get It Recruit - Real Estate helps job seekers connect with employers and opportunities that match their qualifications. Once connected job seekers can complete the full application process directly on the employer's website.We have an exciting contract opportunity with one of the largest commercial banks, located at their Fulton Drive location. Join our Mortgage Customer Service team and help provide exceptional service to our customers. You'll apply mortgage tax and escrow, and resolve any customer issues that arise. This position is initially a 6-month contract with the possibility of extension, and outstanding performers have the opportunity for permanent placement.We offer a hybris work schedule where you'll alternate 1 week in the office and 1 week remote/work from home once fully trained. The starting salary for this role is $14 - $14.25 per hour with first shift work hours of 8 AM - 4:30 PM. The educational requirement for this position is a high school diploma or equivalent.As a Customer Support Representative, your responsibilities will include performing routine clerical or job data entry functions within mortgage operations or servicing departments. You will retrieve archived files, process paperwork, gather and verify data, and transfer data into a standard format.Qualifications for this role include a minimum of 1 year of experience in mortgage lending, escrow, or customer service. Proficiency in Microsoft Excel is also required.Please note that for certain assignments, Covid-19 vaccination and/or testing may be required by our client or applicable federal mandate, subject to approved medical or religious accommodations. LMI seeks a Data Scientist/Statistician to support a federal directorate in the National Capital Region. Join our team of collaborative self-starters focused on delivering practical and efficient solutions to help our client keep U.S. borders safe and facilitate trade and travel. As part of our high-performing team, you will augment our vital work to provide “eyes and ears” technology to protect our nation.




LMI is a consultancy dedicated to improving the business of government, drawing from deep expertise in advanced analytics, digital services, logistics, and management advisory services. Established in 1961, LMI is a trusted third party to federal civilian, national security, and defense agencies, operating free of commercial and political bias. For nearly 60 years, LMI has worked with 40 government agencies. From the departments of Defense to Health and Human Services, LMI is honored to support the government's mission and people around the globe. We believe government can make a difference, and we seek talented, hardworking, mission-driven people who share that conviction.




LMI offers a generous compensation package with excellent benefits that start the first day of employment. Flexible work schedules, tuition reimbursement, generous retirement contributions and leave policies; are a few of our many work-life benefits available to our employees.




This individual will provide data analytics / data governance support to the United States Customs and Border Protection (CBP) U.S Border Patrol (USBP) Strategic Planning and Analysis Directorate (SPAD) Advance Analytics & Data Governance (AA&DG) Division.




Specific Responsibilities May Include




Develops experimental and analytical research for data analysis, use effective baselines, and accurately determine potential cause and effect relations.
Leads performing analysis in Python.
Frames and scales data problems to analyze, visualize, and find data solutions.
Manipulates common data formats, including comma-delimited, text files, and JSON.
Transforms data and analysis into informative visualizations and interactive dashboards using open-source and commercially available visualization and dashboard tools.
Derives insights and analytic narratives from data and visualizations for effective storytelling and clear communication in response to research questions.
Develops experimental and analytical research for data analysis, use effective baselines, and accurately determine potential cause and effect relations.
Works in a fast-paced, solutions-oriented environment focused on client deliverables, analysis, and reporting
Bachelor’s degree in data science, mathematics, statistics, economics, computer science, engineering, or a related business or quantitative discipline
1-5 years of experience required
Stays current on best practice in the statistical field, including methodologies and statistical concepts.
Working knowledge of databases and SQL; preferred qualifications include linking analytic and data visualization products to database connections
Preferred experience with data science methods related to data architecture, data munging, data and feature engineering, and predictive analytics; additional preferred qualifications include working with unstructured text and natural language processing
Preferred experience with timeseries data
Broad knowledge of ML methods, statistical analysis, and problem-solving skills
Excellent oral and written communication skills, organizational skills, and problem-solving skills
Resourcefulness and troubleshooting aptitude
Attention to detail
Previous work with CBP and/or USBP is a plus.
Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.




This position allows for partial telework with the ability to work virtually and travel to client site in DMV as required.




Applicants selected for this position will be subject to a comprehensive government security investigation must meet eligibility requirements for access to sensitive information. The background investigation includes financial, criminal, residential, educational, foreign affiliation, and employment verifications. US citizenship required




Highly Preferred: Active/Full U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) BI
This position is contingent upon completion of CBP BI

Job Title: Business Intelligence Engineer II/Marketing Data Analyst

Duration: 6+ months contract to begin with Possible Extension)

Location: Culver City, CA (Onsite)

Required

- Podcasting may not bring to mind big data, but with a public feed database of over 7.5 Billion rows, big data is very much in play at Wondery. Experience in working with and manipulating massive datasets is a must.

- Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative or technical field (Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering)

- 2+ years’ experience as an Analyst and with marketing analytics, preferably at a media or entertainment organization

- Experience with and strong understanding of performance marketing concepts, including attribution models

- Proficient in SQL

- Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Periscope, Looker, Plot.ly)

- Experience with web and mobile analytics solutions (Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Mixpanel)

- Experience with tag management solutions (Google Tag Manager, Adobe DTM, Tealium, Segment)

- Experience with sales CRM solutions (Salesforce, Boostr)

- Strong familiarity with statistical concepts

- Strong communicator with the ability to understand and interact with varying audiences and stakeholders

- Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills

- A self-starter, able to excel in a fast-paced work environment.




Responsibilities

- Work cross-functionally with Integrated Marketing and Sales teams to become intimately familiar with organizational initiatives, operational processes, and business performance

- Standardize campaign performance analytics, develop framework for regularly socializing performance results and insights, and become a strategic advisor to the marketing team by using historic data to guide their planning process

- Provide input and insights into post-launch and post-campaign wrap-ups for executive stakeholders, become the authoritative voice on results while providing context and other insights

- Ensure initiatives are properly implemented, both from a methodological and from a data capture perspective

- Interact with 3rd party vendors to help innovate and stay ahead of industry trends.




Compensation

The pay rate range above is the base hourly pay range that Aditi Consulting reasonably expects to pay someone for this position (compensation may vary outside of this range depending on a number of factors, including but not limited to, a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies, experience, location and end client requirements).

Benefits and Ancillaries

Medical, dental, vision, PTO benefits and ancillaries may be available for eligible Aditi Consulting employees and vary based on the plan options selected by the employee.

Founded in 2010 and based in New York, QA Mentor, Inc. is multi-awards winning ISO 27001:2013 and ISO 9001:2015 certified leading independent software testing company headquartered in New York. With 284 global QA resources in 8 different countries offering more than 30 QA Testing Services and covering all time zones, QA Mentor is a global leader in Software Quality Assurance and Testing space. Our client, a Global Investment Bank, is seeking a Jr. Analyst in their Baltimore, Maryland location.




Overview:

As the business has a significant growth strategy and expands into new traded products, this is an exciting time for the group to play a critical role in

Portfolio management
Driving and executing new initiatives
Meeting regulatory requirements
Working to improve risk governance

Responsibilities:

Responsible for monitoring and reporting of intraday and end of day limits, excesses and collateral disputes.
Responsible for exposure and portfolio management of counterparties and effective management of risk in derivative transactions.
Conduct what-if analysis on new transactions and counterparty portfolio.
Utilize what-if analysis to determine appropriate risk limits and work with credit officers and with front office to formulate recommendations.
On an ongoing basis, analyze counterparty credit exposure on various metrics such as Expected Positive Exposure, Potential Future Exposure, etc.
Play a key role in executing ongoing improvements in data quality and reporting infrastructure.
Support new initiatives and projects to enhance portfolio management and exposure management.
Generate daily exposure reports on Securities Business (Cash Bond, Cash Equity, Security Lending, Repo and Futures) in order to monitor limit usage and distribute to Front Office and Credit Department.
Input and maintain Credit data in proprietary systems (counterparty limit amount, rating, on-boarding information, etc).
Provide analysis of high limit usage and excess.

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Finance/Mathematics/Engineering.
Strong analytical and quantitative background.
Experience in Python, VBA, SQL.
Knowledge of derivative products/counterparty credit risk.
Excellent written and verbal presentation skills Strong attention to detail.
Strong office administrative skills.
Ability to work closely with partners, provide direction and follow-up to get the job done.

Have you been looking to shift your career into high gear? This is your opportunity to take your ambitions and convert them into a solid career in a supportive and innovative environment!

Summit2Sea is looking for a Data Governance Consultant.

Summit2Sea is a technology consulting firm run by hands on technologists that combines people, process and technology to deliver innovative solutions to our clients. We have been named on The Washington Post's list of top work places for the past 3 years! We invest in our biggest asset - our people! You can be a part of a winning team that will contribute to your career growth.

Impactful Work You'll Do:

Work to develop and maintain data sharing agreements with system owners, as part of the data acquisition process
Create initial draft agreements and coordinate and facilitate information gathering to populate technical details within the program template—such as connection method, data requirements, and sensitive data review
Interact with internal technical engineers and functional data analysts as well as customer stakeholders
Advance the organization's thinking of data governance concepts, explaining the benefits of data governance policies and procedures within the context of the user's needs
Assist with the establishment and maintenance of the data catalog by creating system pages and populating relevant information which is gathered from the data sharing agreement process
Prompt sensitive data reviews to flag sensitive data
Interacts with team members across the entire program, affording insight into the program as a whole


Requirements

What We are Looking For:

A team player who considers themselves a ‘best athlete’ (rather than a situational role player), yet always applies their talents toward the greater good of the team
An ambitious self-starter who is able to learn quickly, and apply established process and procedure to work independently in a dynamic environment
A disciplined individual with attention for detail, great time management, is organized, and displayed the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
Someone who is comfortable and confident working with multiple parties, to facilitate a coordinated effort toward a shared goal and create/maintain professional connections in relatively insular communities
A person who has a thirst for knowledge and thrives on the opportunity to solve a complex problems
An individual with a methodical, analytic, yet creative problem solving mind and the confidence to bring innovative ideas to the table—follow established processes and procedures, but always look for ways to improve, and coordinate with the team to review and implement efficiencies


Must Have:

Ability to represent and uphold our core values of integrity, client service, expertise, adaptability, communication, and teamwork
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong technical writing experience
Experience with Data Management / Data Analytics
Experience with Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Experience ensuring that data analysis is accurate, with acute attention to detail
Experience with briefing senior managers on project status and identified risks
Active DoD Secret (or higher) Clearance (interim is ok)
BS degree


Nice to Have:

Prior experience writing/managing data sharing agreement, customer agreement, or other official or technical documents (such as policy, standard operating procedure, official memo documents, SV-6or other system technical documents, etc.)
Proficient/Advanced knowledge and experience with Data Analysis / Data Management knowledge
Experience with JIRA
Experience with Collibra


Benefits

Upper Tier Compensation includes a base salary and bonuses based upon: performance, business development, employee referrals and knowledge sharing. We value the individual and share our company's success across our team.

Summit2Sea is committed to offering our employees a benefits package that is competitive and comprehensive enough to meet their goals and needs. As a valued member of the S2S team, employees are provided with a collection of benefits to include paid holidays, health and dental care to name a few.

‍

Competitive Base Salary
Quarterly Recruiting Bonus
New Sales Bonus
Knowledge Contribution Bonus


Benefit Components

Paid Holidays
Vacation/Sick Leave/Personal Time Off
Health Insurance

Job/Position DescriptionProvider Finance DepartmentQuality Review UnitData Analyst IIIJob DescriptionTexas Health and Human Services (HHS) Provider Finance department (PFD) seeks a highly qualified candidate to fill the position of Data Analyst III in the Quality Review Unit (QRU). PFD is driven by its mission to deliver quality, cost-effective services to Texans. This position makes a significant contribution to PFDand#146;s mission by assisting with financial reporting activities.The Data Analyst III performs moderately complex (journey-level) data collection, reporting and analysis to monitor, evaluate, and increase efficiencies for PFD. Work involves conducting detailed analysis of and extensive research on data, used for fiscal estimates and deliverables. Prepares concise, comprehensive technical reports to present and interpret data, identify alternatives, and make and justify recommendations on data revisions. Develop queries, processes, and analyze data using SQL. Assists in defining, developing, implementing data standards, developing data quality measures, analyzing data quality results, and implementing necessary changes to ensure data quality improvement. May establish and maintain standard work procedures governing the appropriate use of data, develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality. May provide guidance to others. The Data Analyst works with various teams to explore different aspects of a system (people, policy, and processes) to determine why particular areas are performing well or have opportunities for improvement. Identifies and interprets data patterns and trends and assesses data quality. Works under general supervision, with limited latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.The ideal candidate thrives in an environment that emphasizes: teamwork to achieve goals, excellence through high professional standards and personal accountability, curiosity to continuously grow and learn, critical thinking for effective execution, and integrity to do things right even when what is right is not easy.Essential Job FunctionsEssential Job Functions:Attends work on a regular and predictable schedule in accordance with agency leave policy and performs other duties as assigned.Analyzes data using standard statistical tools, methods, and techniques. Develop queries, processes, and analyze data using SQL. Consults with internal and external customers and PFD staff to identify user needs. Compiles and queries data using SQL. Identifies data gaps, errors, anomalies, inconsistencies, and redundancies by analyzing the content, structure, and relationships within data. Interprets results to identify significant differences in data. Identifies and interprets data patterns and trends and assesses data quality. Cleans and prunes data to discard irrelevant information. (30%)Prepares concise, comprehensive technical reports to present and interpret data, identify alternatives, and make and justify recommendations on data revisions. Assists in defining, developing, and implementing data standards. Assists in developing data quality measures, analyzing data quality results, and implementing necessary changes to ensure data quality improvement. Assists in developing software applications or programming to use for statistical modeling and graphic analysis.
