Children's Cardiology, a subsidiary of Children's Healthcare of Atlanta, is comprised of more than 50 pediatric cardiologists providing comprehensive services for patients from before birth to age 21 who have acquired or congenital heart disease. The Charge Capture Coordinator handles charge entry, report generating, audit, and update of charges/receipts coupled with timely and accurate billing of services rendered.




Minimum Qualifications

Associates degree preferred or equivalent work experience.
Minimum of two years charge entry experience.
Preferred experience in a healthcare institution and understanding of medical terminology including billing and coding; ICD-10 and CPT codes.
Preferred experience with Epic.
Proficient in 10-Key with no less than 13,500 KPH (50 WPM).
Proficient in Microsoft Office.
Strong attention to detail, organizational skills and follow-through discipline required.
Effective oral and written communication required.




Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Enter a minimum of 25 patient demographics and 100 charge tickets per day.
Work Epic work queue’s daily.
Research missing patient demographics and authorizations.
Obtain authorizations from medical centers and verify patient insurance eligibility.
Assist with the daily audit, update of charges and receipts.
File documents in designated locations.
Support the continuous assessment and improvement of the quality of services provided.
Meet and follow all requirements outlined in department and company policies.
Perform other duties and projects as assigned.




All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any protected category.




As a part of the recruiting and new hire process with Children’s Cardiology, employment history will be verified and ANY false statements, omissions or misrepresentations of your application or resume will result in not being hired by the company.

Role: SR Data Analyst 

Position : Contract

Location : Dallas,Tx / Auburn hills ,MIHybrid (TX/MI) - once in a week onsite




 

Positions for a Sr. Data Analyst

 

This position requires a mix of data analytics with some technical development. Understanding of various database types (SQL, Oracle, DB2, etc). Knowledge of database schemas, taxonomy, access/permissions, metadata, and data lineage needed. Experience with Collibra is preferred. Candidates must be self-motivated, be able to follow a project plan with minimal supervision, and be able to learn processes and application configurations quickly. Communication and documentation is critical, therefore verbal and written skills are essential.  

 

Primary work: harvesting application metadata and creating technical lineage using Collibra. This includes working with application SMEs to understand the structure and schema's of application databases, configuring Collibra to harvest the metadata, scheduling change controls, harvesting the metadata, and creating the technical lineage.

Our client, a large well-known Media and Entertainment company is urgently looking to hire a Data Scientist to join their team remotely!




** This is a fully remote 6-month contract role offering benefits and the opportunity for extension or conversion**




What You Will Be Doing:

Develop predictive models using statistical, machine learning and data mining methodologies
Apply cleansing, discretization, imputation, selection, generalization etc. to create high quality features for the modelling process
Work with business stakeholders to define business requirements including KPI and acceptance criteria
Use big data, relational and non-relational data sources to access data at the appropriate level of granularity for the needs of specific analytical projects.
Maintains up to date knowledge of the relevant data set structures and participate in defining necessary upgrades and modifications.




Required Skills & Experience:

Advanced (Master or PhD) degree with specialization in Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, Economics, Mathematics, Operations Research or another quantitative field or equivalent
3+ years of combined experience in advanced analytics in industry or research
Experience in being a lead data scientist on large projects
Deep knowledge of statistical methods and machine learning with special emphasis on the advanced algorithms
Expert level in 5+ classes of algorithms
Proficient in Python and SQL




Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis now and in the future
Industries: Movies, Videos, and Sound and Entertainment Providers

We are currently seeking a Telecom technician with a minimum of 2 yrs. experience trouble shooting and installing Data and Phone cabling. Looking for 1 full time technician. Tech must have at a minimum a reliable vehicle that can carry a little giant style ladder and basic network cabling tools. Tech must have a professional appearance and the ability to communicate in a professional manner. This position is for a field service call technician for voice, data and video cabling. Experience trouble shooting PBX and VoiP systems with tech support would be helpful. Most service calls will be at major retailers and business offices.Also offering a $1000 sign on bonus for a qualified technician. Must have a clean driving record Must pass a background checkWe are a small personalized company with a large footprint that can guarantee work flow due to our excellent reputation for being on time and finishing the work assigned to us. If you are a like minded individual with a strong work ethic then we would invite you to join our team.

We are hiring an experienced Data Scientist for the Implementation Automation Center of Excellence. Candidate should have relevant professional experience with document classification, entity recognition, and optical character recognition (OCR). 
 
Minimum of two (2) years of experience must include:



Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, Deep learning social network analysis, etc.
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications. 
Knowledge of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks. etcScikit-learn, TensorFlowExperience querying databases and using statistical computer languages: SQL, R, Python,
Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc.
Experience with distributed data/computing tools: Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Gurobi, MySQL, etc.
Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders using: Tableau, ggplot, etc.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.

A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.



Education & Experience Requirements:



Master's or PHD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, predictive analytics or another quantitative field plus



two (2) years of related experience

About Us




Parsley Health is a digital health company with a mission to transform the health of everyone, everywhere with the world's best possible medicine. Today, Parsley Health is the nation's largest health care company helping people suffering from chronic conditions find relief with root cause resolution medicine. Our work is inspired by our members’ journeys and our actions are focused on impact and results.




The Opportunity




Parsley Health is hiring a Director of Business Operations to help shape the strategy, operations, and culture at Parsley Health. We are growing and scaling our business and we need strong cross-functional execution to build a new type of healthcare company.




The primary goal of the role is smooth, well-informed internal operations, including everything from ownership of our OKR process, specific cross team OKRs and initiatives, cross team communication, and company-wide accountability and ownership. In addition you will serve as a key member of the executive team where your role will be ensuring important strategic and operational pieces are executed with high fidelity and that stakeholders across the executive team and the broader company are communicated to and held accountable to deliverables.




Other specific ownership areas include running the executive team’s rhythm, convening and steering the broader leadership group, driving cross-company business operations, and identifying and directing new projects for the company.




This role will expose you to the full breadth of company departments and decisions, offering opportunities for you to make an impact big and small. As a part of our matrixed environment, you will serve as connective tissue and identify company needs.




What You’ll Do




Executive Leadership: plan and run the executive team meeting rhythm to help our senior team stay aligned and accountable, find resolutions quickly, improve business outcomes, and work well across the company
Leadership Alignment: gather the broader leadership group across the company for connectivity and collaboration, ultimately improving cross-company performance
Operations: spearhead and lead the company’s quarterly and annual planning cycles to efficiently set goals and effectively communicate direction for the whole company; develop and improve other company systems for better communication, alignment, and empowerment
Strategic Direction: coming out of planning discussions, make recommendations on longer-term business plans and their impact on the organization
Project Execution: identify and run special projects, collaborate with finance and data team on creating models and business case framework, and owning execution that help push the company forward in new ways
While needs will evolve over time, we expect this role will be allocated ~45% to executive and leadership team success, ~45% to company business operations, and ~10% to special projects




What You’ll Need




6+ years of work experience in a mixture of consulting, operations, and strategic roles; startup experience is key
Successful track record driving change cross-functionally through influential leadership
Exceptional structured thinking and organization skills for yourself, and broader team process building skills that balance effort with return
Bias for action and sense of urgency - you will help the company’s executive team make choices and move faster
Strong analytical skills (Excel and Looker proficiency is preferred)
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Comfort operating in ambiguity
Scale-up healthtech experience is a nice-to-have




Benefits And Compensation




Equity Stake
401(k) + Employer Matching program
Remote-first with the option to work from one of our centers in NYC or LA
Complimentary Parsley Health Complete Care membership
Subsidized Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance plan options
Generous 4+ weeks of paid time off
Annual professional development stipend




Parsley Health is committed to providing an equitable, fair and transparent compensation program for all employees.




The starting salary for this role is between $148,750 - $175,000, depending on skills and experience. We take a geo-neutral approach to compensation within the US, meaning that we pay based on job function and level, not location.




Individual compensation decisions are based on a number of factors, including experience level, skillset, and balancing internal equity relative to peers at the company. We expect the majority of the candidates who are offered roles at our company to fall healthily throughout the range based on these factors. We recognize that the person we hire may be less experienced (or more senior) than this job description as posted. If that ends up being the case, the updated salary range will be communicated with candidates during the process.




At Parsley Health we believe in celebrating everything that makes us human and are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We embrace diversity and are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We believe that the more inclusive we are, the better we can serve our members.




Important Note




In light of recent increase in hiring scams, if you're selected to move onto the next phase of our hiring process, a member of our Talent Acquisition team will reach out to you directly from an @parsleyhealth.com email address to guide you through our interview process. We look forward to connecting!

develop and improve other company systems for better communication, alignment, and empowerment Strategic Direction: coming out of planning discussions, make recommendations on longer-term business plans and their impact on the organization Project Execution: identify and run special projects, collaborate with finance and data team on creating models and business case framework, and owning execution that help push the company forward in new ways While needs will evolve over time, we expect this role will be allocated ~45% to executive and leadership team success, ~45% to company business operations, and ~10% to special projects What You’ll Need6+ years of work experience in a mixture of consulting, operations, and strategic roles; startup experience is key Successful track record driving change cross-functionally through influential leadership Exceptional structured thinking and organization skills for yourself, and broader team process building skills that balance effort with return Bias for action and sense of urgency - you will help the company’s executive team make choices and move faster Strong analytical skills (Excel and Looker proficiency is preferred) Strong verbal and written communication skills Comfort operating in ambiguity Scale-up healthtech experience is a nice-to-have Benefits And CompensationEquity Stake401(k) + Employer Matching programRemote-first with the option to work from one of our centers in NYC or LA Complimentary Parsley Health Complete Care membershipSubsidized Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance plan optionsGenerous 4+ weeks of paid time offAnnual professional development stipendParsley Health is committed to providing an equitable, fair and transparent compensation program for all employees.The starting salary for this role is between $148,750 - $175,000, depending on skills and experience. We take a geo-neutral approach to compensation within the US, meaning that we pay based on job function and level, not location.Individual compensation decisions are based on a number of factors, including experience level, skillset, and balancing internal equity relative to peers at the company. We expect the majority of the candidates who are offered roles at our company to fall healthily throughout the range based on these factors. Job_title: Early Careers Data Engineering and Data Science Intern
Job_description:
Aon is looking for Early Careers Data Engineering and Data Science 2023 Summer Interns to join our team.




Location of Job: Boston, MA; Seattle, WA; Spokane, WA; New York, NY; Chicago, IL; or Remote.




About the Position: Aon Intellectual Property Solutions helps clients protect and improve their most valuable asset in today’s business world—their intellectual property. Aon brings the best minds and strong analytical tools to provide a comprehensive approach to intellectual property strategy, valuation, and risk management across a client’s business.




As a Data Engineering Intern, you will work on our data pipelines and organize raw data. As a Data Science Intern, you will build statistical and machine learning models to answer sophisticated questions related to IP analysis, valuation, and risk modeling. The questions we answer range from “How many lawsuits will your company have next year?” to “Are the patents you own actually any good?”




Our larger team consists primarily of computer science, math, and physics majors and PhDs. We value a genuine work-life balance and offer excellent compensation and stability.




Our ideal candidate balances domain expertise, initiative, accuracy, self-motivation, organization, and articulate & detailed communications. Intellectual curiosity, creativity, integrity, and professionalism are critical traits for success in this role.




Required Education:




Undergrad with significant computer science, data engineering/ data science, and quantitative coursework




Required Skills and Attributes:




Experience with a modern software language; we use Python extensively
Experience with a relational database such as PostgreSQL
Inquisitive mind and passion for data science or data engineering
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Data Engineering Intern - Experience with organizing data using distributed version-control systems such as Git
Data Science Intern - Experience with data analysis and statistical packages (Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn)




Additional Preferred Skills - Data Engineering:




Experience with cloud systems like AWS or Azure
Database schema design experience, indexing optimizing for performance
ETL experience, including data cleaning and preparation for modeling
Some visualization experience such as Tableau or PowerBI is helpful




Additional Preferred Skills - Data Science:




Experience in data cleaning and performing exploratory data analysis for proof of concept and prototyping
Experience building machine learning models
Experience with organizing data using distributed version-control systems such as Git
Experience with cloud systems like AWS or Azure
Some visualization experience such as Tableau or PowerBI is helpful




Expectations:




Help build products as needed for all IP Solutions business units
Collaborate effectively with people at all levels in the organization




Data Engineering




Receive and perform code reviews with other engineers
Write unit, integration, and end-to-end tests to verify functionality using automated testing frameworks such as pytest
Participate in Agile teams to develop, test, and debug complex data processing pipelines and data analysis applications using big data processing systems and patterns.
Diagnose, debug, and perform root cause analysis of issues and defects.




Data Science




Work on the IP Solutions data cleaning and preparation pipeline
Develop ways to use data to repeatably answer questions for other IP Solutions partners




Benefits:




You will be a member of the Aon IP Solutions team, one of the few players in a unique and rapidly growing space




Opportunity to work on research problems, and present results at meetings and conferences
A supportive team that encourages work-life balance, professional growth, and open communication
Flexible remote work or in-office options




Applicants for this role, which is part of the Aon Summer Internship Program, should be rising seniors, graduating between December 2023 - June 2024 and have a GPA of 3.0 or above.




Unrestricted U.S. work authorization is required for U.S. office locations. We do not offer sponsorship for this position - CPT and OPT are restricted forms of work authorization.




Aon Summer Internship Program




Aon’s Summer Internship Program provides a unique opportunity for rising college seniors to learn, contribute, and gain real world work experience in a collaborative environment. Interns have the chance to learn more about Aon’s culture and businesses while developing practical skills necessary for future success and postgraduate opportunities. The 10-week summer program includes weekly spotlights delivered by Aon business leaders, a community outreach event and networking opportunities with fellow interns and colleagues. The program equips interns with an understanding of working in an environment dedicated to exceeding client expectations and delivering products and services distinct to unique client needs.




A Value Adding Program Development Plan (Curriculum)




In addition to on-the-job training, our interns actively participate, along with their fellow intern colleagues, in a formal Development Plan. This provides interns:
An understanding of the basic functions and types of clients within Aon’s businesses
An understanding of Aon’s ethical standards
Training geared toward enabling interns to demonstrate an ability to work in a professional business environment
Opportunities to network with fellow peers, Aon colleagues and executive leadership at program social events and interactive speaker forums
Opportunities to learn and use Aon’s internal systems
Opportunities to demonstrate interpersonal and team building skills through many networking events




An Opportunity to Explore Post Graduation Career Path Opportunities




The goal of the Aon Summer Internship Program is to give students significant exposure to Aon through project deliverables, continuing education and a training curriculum. The program also provides students with an excellent opportunity to learn and prepare for post‐graduate career opportunities at Aon. Upon successful completion of the Aon Summer Internship Program, highly qualified interns may be offered post-graduation full‐time positions within the Launch Program, Aon’s Early Career Development Program.




How We Support Our Colleagues




The target salary range for this position is $21 - $25 per hour. The actual salary will vary based on applicant’s education, experience, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity and alignment with market data. The salary may also be adjusted based on applicant’s geographic location.




At Aon, we offer a competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization. Plus, our agile, inclusive environment allows you to manage your wellbeing and work/life balance, ensuring you can be your best self at Aon. Furthermore, all colleagues enjoy two “Global Wellbeing Days” each year, encouraging you to take time to focus on yourself. We offer a variety of working style solutions, but we also recognize that flexibility goes beyond just the place of work... and we are all for it. We call this Smart Working!




Our continuous learning culture inspires and equips you to learn, share and grow, helping you achieve your fullest potential. As a result, at Aon, you are more connected, more relevant, and more valued.




Aon values an innovative, diverse workplace where all colleagues feel empowered to be their authentic selves. Aon is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.




Aon provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran, marital, domestic partner status, or other legally protected status. Aon is committed to a diverse workforce and is an affirmative action employer. People with criminal histories are encouraged to apply.




We provide individuals with disabilities reasonable accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment in accordance with applicable law. Please contact us to request an accommodation on ReasonableAdjustments@Aon.com




Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.




Aon offers a benefits package for temporary and seasonal employees who will work 20 or more hours per week including: medical, dental, and vision insurance at the employee’s expense, critical illness insurance, 10 Company holidays per calendar year (paid, if eligible), paid sick leave as provided under state and local law, and a 401(k) savings plan with employer contributions. Eligibility for benefits are governed by the applicable plan documents and policies.




#AonInternUS




#IPSolutionsUS

Title: MDM Analyst(Master Data Management Analyst)

Location: Atlanta, GA

Client: CRH

Onsite Hybrid 2 day at the Office

Hybrid Role Perimeter area

Our client seeks a Master Data Management Analyst to support their Data Governance workstream under their Data & Analytics Organization.

The ideal candidate will possess significant data management experience allowing them to serve as the champion for data governance ensuring

that the design and integrity of Master Datasets is maintained within and across our client's systems.

Responsibilities

Uses knowledge of end-to-end processes to analyze, cleanse, and enrich master data elements

Defines critical Data Quality metrics and establish a process to measure and report on them

Identifies and facilitates the integration of MDM with other applications to ensure data integrity across our client's systems

Leads the discussions with the Data Domain owners to define & maintain relevant hierarchy structures

Troubleshoots issues related to MDM and identifies opportunities for improving data management processes

·      Continually remain apprised of the constantly changing landscape of the healthcare industry and any impacts it may have to our Analytical programs and reporting mechanisms

·      Analyze key stakeholder complaints, address rapidly, and discuss with applicable functional leads to collaborate and propose impactful and realistic solutions

·      Maintain data integrity and traceability across the transformation lifecycle from the Source to Target

·      Contribute to the management and prioritization of process improvement and innovation initiatives

·      Partner with WWPS-BCI team members to lead the design of insight-driven innovative strategies

·      Define and provide metric reporting and data analysis for BCI initiatives including relevant insights to facilitate decision-making process

·      Assess and interpret the process impact of new PV tools and processes

·      Life Sciences, Information, or similar background (Bachelors, Masters.

·      5+ years Drug Safety/Pharmacovigilance experience

·      Advanced Tableau & Spotfire skills with 4+ years of development experience

·      Databases (Postgres, Oracle, MS Access, SharePoint List etc.)

·      Programming languages (SQL, VBA, Python etc.)

·      Reporting platforms and services (Cognos, SAP-Business Objects, Power BI etc.)

·      Knowledge and application of commercial coding dictionaries (MedDRA, WHO Drug)

·      Ability to organize/curate data and see big picture from scattered pieces of information

·      Knowledge of taxonomies, ontologies, and other knowledge management constructs

·      Analytical and strategic thinking skills required

·      Strong PowerPoint, Word, and Excel Skills

·      Knowledge of Validation processes and associated documentation.

·      Ability to promote cooperation and commitment within a team to achieve goals and deliverables.

·      Ability to resolve complex problems and manage difficult stakeholder situations

·      Ability to lead the development of critical path analyses and support scenario planning

·      Promotes and practices effective pro-active decision-making, ensuring timely coordination and dissemination of information

·      Demonstrated ability to work on multiple projects

·      Strong willingness to collaborate with cross-functional partners

·      Flexible, team member with positive attitude, friendly demeanor, ability to prioritize projects and balance competing priorities

Golden sets, creates data sets for computers to learn what something is. In order to learn data, set and to see if they are good we need to label a subset- if there are a million images we need to label 10k ourselves. We need to know if we annotate the same as our third-party vendors 90% of the time or 100% we want to make sure that we streamline the way that work through these labels. We need to understand if the data set is actually good or not and that we are properly and accurately labeling things. They will be doing the labels and annotating the data basically doing quality control on the data. Streamlining the process 10-20% of the time the 80-90% is making sure the data is accurate.
Attending meetings
Creates golden data sets for images
Create instruction guides to teach people how to label the candidate will be contributing to these guides as well 10-15%
Testing end to end labeling process
Working with third party vendors that they will be annotating with
Testing to see if the annotating makes sense and annotating based on the instruction guides that they are contributing to
Customer facing position working on visual searches

1+ years of related work experience – data entry
1+ years of experience with Excel or related work experience
Ability to detect visual differences in images and videos
Needs to have experience with computers a lot and know things like save a file
They need to know spot the difference between similar items
Extremely visually detailed oriented
No max years of experience
Open to everyone with a visual background
No degree requirements
Email writing
Candidates must have used the app visual features before the interview!
PREFERRED SKILLS*
Must have high attention to detail, be well organized and a self-starter
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with strong interpersonal communication skills
Experience operating in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment
Advanced data entry experience with the ability to navigate and manipulate large data sets
Machine learning/AI – Teaching the computer how to learn information. Teaching the computer slang and accents etc.

Collaborate with a rapid response team to learn quickly and respond to ad hoc needs

Determine the structure, content, and quality of the data through examination of source systems and data samples

Acra Lending is looking for an experienced Business Development Analyst to join the team!




This position will be HYBRID.




This position will be responsible in managing correspondent client ("Seller") relationships, analyze and compile data related to seller transactions with Acra Lending.




Essential Duties And Responsibilities




Facilitate the submission of qualified loans for flow eligibility reviews, administer providing eligibility reviews to correspondent clients ("Sellers"), administer obtaining conditions from Sellers and tasking condition reviews to Acra resources. Other responsibilities include:




Guide/instruct clients on documents required for qualified eligibility review submissions.




Review loan submissions for correct parsing and indexing of submission documents and to ensure required submission documents are provided by clients.




Collect and report production metrics by client related to submissions.




Work with loan setup on correcting any inadequate submissions.




Distribute completed eligibility reviews to clients and facilitate addressing any questions clients may have related to eligibility reviews.




Receive/collect conditions from clients and task conditions to appropriate operations fulfillment personnel. A) task conditions to Correspondent Credit personnel, B) task conditions to appropriate appraisal review personnel.




Parse, index and task purchase documents associated with closed loan packages (flow and delegated).




Track, manage report, and analyze production metrics for each client, including but not limited to: a) submission to purchasing ratios, submission to cancellation ratios, loan amounts, rates, number of operations touches per loan.




Knowledge And Skills Required




Minimum of 1 year experience in processing mortgage loans in either a retail, wholesale or correspondent context.




Credentials And Experience Required




Excellent verbal and written communication skills.




Experience with Microsoft Excel and ability to compile and analyze data.




Pay Range: $50,000-57,000 Annually. Our pay range is based upon experience, education, location and qualifications.

 Move about the office (stand and walk)

 Hear, talk, read, and write




 Employee Is Occasionally Required To




 Lift up to 25 pounds




 Vision Requirements Include




 Close vision (computer monitor, paperwork)

each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, kill, and abilities required in this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable

Ability to perform duties while standing/sitting/bending for extended periods of time




This job posting provides cursory examples of some of the job duties associated with this position. The examples provided are not complete, and the position may entail other essential and job-related functions and responsibilities that employees will be required to perform.




We’re Infinia Search.




We’re a relationship-driven search firm that proves that talent, ambition, curiosity, and an infinite work ethic creates exponential results for our clients and candidates. Our expertise spans many disciplines, from professional services to our latest expansion into healthcare.




https://www.infiniasearch.com/

Who We Are

We’re seeking a Senior Data Analyst to join our Product Analytics team to help drive Vox Media’s subscriptions strategy. The ideal candidate is confident and creative in their data analysis; can effectively communicate results and recommendations to business and product leaders; and can confidently lead collaboration across technical, design, product, and business groups.

The Product Analytics team is part of a growing Analytics Department that consists of SEO, Product Analytics, and Newsroom Analytics. Our mission is to use data to help Vox Media grow our audiences and businesses.

This role reports to the Director, Product Analytics.

What You’ll Do

Work closely with business, product, and engineering counterparts to build reporting and analyses to help inform our subscriptions business strategy
Make data-informed recommendations to business leaders and product managers on new or better ways to improve our users’ experiences
Set up data models using Google BigQuery that can power everything from executive-level KPI business reporting to exploratory dashboards to help our cross-team partners make strategic decisions
Build analytics models to inform our user engagement strategy by connecting complex, disparate data sources, communicating those findings to VP-level stakeholders, and incorporating their feedback into new iterations of the model
Partner with Data Engineering teams to establish data modeling and governance best practices for Analytics teams
Become the subject-matter expert for metrics and reporting in your field – understand why stakeholders need what they need, communicate data gaps, advocate for new metrics if needed, and then work with engineering and product teams to build them
Document your models, reports, and dashboards, and write how-to guides to support stakeholders across Vox Media
Maintain strong relationships with revenue, product, editorial, design, and engineering teams to build the best user experience possible

Who You Are

2+ years of relatable data analytics experience
Proficiency in Excel and/or Google Sheets, Looker, LookML, Looker Studio, Tableau, or other dashboarding platforms
Proficiency in database querying languages such as MS SQL, PostgreSQL, Google BigQuery, or Snowflake
Experience with Google Analytics, Parse.ly, or other behavioral tracking platforms
You are analytical and detail oriented, with a passion—not just for reporting data—but digging deeper to identify underlying themes around key trends, results and critical outcomes

Bonus points for:

Experience using data modeling software such as R, Python, Stata, Matlab, or SAS
Familiarity with a wide array of statistical methods and techniques, including regression analysis, principal component analysis, clustering, and sampling.
Familiarity with best practices around project management, data governance, and/or reporting documentation

If you think you have what it takes, but don't meet every single point in our job posting, please apply with a cover letter to let us know how you believe you can bring your unique skills to the Vox Media team or get in touch! We’ve hired chefs who became editors, DJs who became UX designers, and sommeliers who became writers.

WHERE YOU’LL WORK

This job is remote (US Only). We’re dedicated to the health and wellbeing of all of our employees, and when we reopen, will require everyone who works from one of our offices to be fully-vaccinated against COVID-19. Employees with approved religious or medical exemptions may be subject to additional safety requirements, such as submitting to regular COVID-19 testing and/or wearing a face covering in our offices.

WHY VOX MEDIA?

What We Offer

This is a permanent, full-time position. This job is benefits-eligible. We pride ourselves in providing comprehensive benefits to support all of our employees wherever they are in life. You can find more information about our benefits here.

OUR DEI+ COMMITMENT

Vox Media is committed to building an inclusive environment where everyone can show up as their authentic selves and create their best work. We recognize that great stories, platforms, products and services come from people with all manner of backgrounds and experiences. We recognize that our commitments require ongoing work and sustained attention, as well as adaptation to new insights and best practices. We keep our diversity data public for the sake of accountability, transparency and communication. Learn more about our values here, and our approach to corporate citizenship here.

Vox Media is an Equal Opportunity Employer and qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, national origin, protected veteran status, age, or any other status protected by applicable national, federal, state, or local law. Vox Media will also consider all qualified applicants with criminal histories in accordance with applicable Fair Chance laws. We are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations as part of the application process to candidates with disabilities. If you require a reasonable accommodation as part of the application process, please contact our People & Culture team (recruitment@voxmedia.com).

What Comes Next

Our recruiting team will go through applications in a timely manner. Please note that our recruiting team will only contact you from @voxmedia.com email addresses, never via text message. Read more about how our recruiting team operates, and how to protect yourself from recruitment fraud, here.

Job Description




As the Director of Data Products, you will establish and drive the Product vision, strategic vision, capabilities, and product positioning for a new set of ATPCO Data Products. As a visionary leader, you will need to understand the economic forces and financial impact in a globally diverse airline industry and how new data products can help airlines better understand market changes and prioritize revenue management opportunities. You will be responsible for the entire data product lifecycle which includes driving the discovery of customer needs, identifying appropriate data sources and data acquisition strategies, securing usage rights where necessary, determining what formats and customer access methods are required, working with our technology team to define an appropriate data platform, identifying and pursuing innovation opportunities around Machine Learning and AI techniques to increase the value of the data provided, leading data product and design efforts, and defining and delivering a data product roadmap and the necessary enhancements.




You Will:




Partner with ATPCO’s Commercial, Strategy, and Technology divisions and as a key part of your mission to identify and target achievable customer value by conducting market research and competitive analysis on broad industry trends affecting the Airlines, GDS’s, and other strategically important customers and market participants
Work cross-functionally with other leaders and divisions within ATPCO, key customers, and industry stakeholders to translate the vision into strategy while identifying product capabilities that will drive the long-range future of the industry and ATPCO’s position in the marketplace
Recruit and hire industry data scientists, collaborate with teams of Data Engineers, Software Engineers, and Business Leaders to define and implement the vision, strategy, products, and tactics required to create desired outcomes
Be responsible for developing ATPCO’s investment business case and bringing to market the identified future data products and solutions
Identify new areas of data product research and development and perform the necessary analysis and evaluation of alternatives using a lean/agile approach
Lead, support, and guide Councils and Design teams on the data evolution to support Dynamic Offers Council
Work with Data Scientist & Technology Leaders to address data fit for purpose and technical risks and explore options to minimize the costs to curate, transform and provide data products
Interact with customers and stakeholders to collect feedback on product features to validate outcomes were met
Communicate to a broad internal audience product progress, adoption, investment recommendations, and value delivered
Manage the staffing and budget under your direction most effectively to achieve Product and corporate objectives




The Ideal Candidate:




Concrete knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, human resources modeling, leadership technique, production methods, and coordination of people and resources
Understanding strategic business opportunities and associates them to potential product outcomes and measure business value and outcomes to communicate to senior leadership
Has a customer-centric view to understand the customer, user persona, customer journeys, pain points, signature moments, and how to direct product solution design to address these topics
Deep understanding of Agile delivery methods focused on eliminating waste, optimizing flow of delivery, defining requirements in terms of customer problems and customer value, and breaking delivery into small units of work, to quicken time-to-value
Uses logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions, or approaches to problems
Ability to analyze business problems, work collaboratively in cross-functional teams, and present data in a clear and concise manner
Additional Information




ATPCO is the foundation of flight shopping, providing pricing and retailing data, tools, and services to 500+ airlines, global distribution systems, sales channels, and technology companies. ATPCO links the entire airline community together, collaborating to develop industry standards for airline distribution and end-to-end technology solutions. From shopping to settlement, ATPCO solutions work seamlessly across existing, new, and evolving technologies and methods. Airline-owned and reliably supporting air travel for more than 55 years, ATPCO is everywhere people buy flights.




Employees are eligible for our benefits package including employer matched 401(k), group health insurance and wellness programs, paid time off, tuition reimbursement, standby flight program and employee collaborated work and life standards.

Job_title: Senior Engineer – Senior Data Analyst and QA Engineer
Job_description:
Position: Senior Engineer Senior Data Analyst and QA Engineer (75% Senior Data Analyst role and 25% QA Engineer role)

100% Remote Work

Long Term Contract

Main Tasks/Profile Abilities

Translate business requirements into software requirements.
Develop and participate in the review of requirements, data mappings, use cases, and other artifacts and clearly communicate to both the business and technical team members the system requirements.
Demonstrate the ability to access data, analyze data, and remediate data issues leveraging SQL and applicable AWS analytics tools such as Athena.
Experience developing testing strategies and identifying comprehensive test scenarios based on business requirements.
Support ad hoc data requests as required as part of the DevOps team.
Demonstrated experience with AWS Lambda, NodeJS, SNS/SQS, S3, IAM, CloudWatch, RDS, DynamoDB, and Athena.
Have experience in Agile software development.
Willingness and ability to perform in multiple roles on a team, including testing and production support as well as data analysis.
Strong ability to understand and internalize the big picture and broader implications.
Self-starter with the ability to set priorities, work independently and attain goals.

Essential Functions/Responsibilities

Communicate and understand business goals and requirements, and work to create data solutions that add value to the business.
Support technical and product managers to ensure that all aspects of the information analysis and requirements-gathering process are completed with the highest degree of accuracy and quality, including the development and socialization of key project artifacts.
Develop and participate in the review of requirements, data mappings, use cases, and other artifacts and clearly communicate to both the business and technical team members the system requirements.
Demonstrate the ability to access data, analyze data, and remediate data issues leveraging SQL and applicable AWS analytics tools such as Athena.
Support team with functional, regression, and end-to-end testing efforts ensuring that features deliver the expected functionality with high quality.
Create and maintain functional and system tests to replicate complex real-world scenarios.
Support ad hoc data requests as required as part of the DevOps team.

Education/Experience

Bachelor's degree required. (MS or MBA is a plus)
A minimum of 5-7 years experience in software development, data management, and applying knowledge, skills, tools, and techniques to a broad range of life-cycle activities in order to meet the requirements for data projects and process improvement initiatives to include agile development process; cloud and microservices analysis, architecture and design; functional and regression testing; and software configuration.
Demonstrated experience with AWS Lambda, Node JS, SNS/SQS, S3, IAM, CloudWatch, RDS, DynamoDB, and Athena.

Related Skills & Other Requirements

Excellent understanding of data management concepts and best practices, as well as an ability to become an SME in education data.
Strong ability to explain advanced data concepts to both database developers and architects, non-technical end users, and senior executives.
Experience with cloud technologies especially AWS serverless development tools and architecture.
Working experience with CI/CD and DevOps
Comfortable with building, deploying, and maintaining web applications in AWS environments (Lambda, DynamoDB, and SQS/SNS).
Experience in developing requirements for business intelligence, master data management, and functional data projects.
Ability to understand business needs and translate them into technical specifications.
Experience with Oracle Database and expertise in understanding and writing SQL.
Demonstrate strong attention to detail, a high degree of initiative, and excellent documentation and communication skills.
Proficiency with Jira and Wiki.

Should you be interested, please send a copy of your resume at swapnil.tayade@kelltontech.net along with the following details ASAP.

Overview

Come join the TurboTax Customer & Business Strategy Team as the Director of Business & Portfolio Analytics. This team is responsible for our overall customer & business strategy and leading the organization to ensure we deliver on growth and revenue commitments. You’ll also be part of an organization that, through customer obsession and innovation, has consistently delivered record-breaking growth in revenue, customers and share.

This critical role for the business will need a candidate with strong data literacy, business acumen, & ability to develop deep industry knowledge/competitive awareness in order to provide senior leaders with a clear picture of industry & share performance/opportunities, guide our customer strategy, identify opportunity segments, & inform our overall business model & monetization strategies. To be successful, this candidate will be required to create strong partnerships & communicate clearly to senior leaders across multiple functions of the organization including Strategy, Marketing, Analytics, Product, Research, & Finance.

This role is a unique and rare opportunity that does not come available often. The candidate will have a direct role in shaping the future strategy of CG at the portfolio level and will work hand-in-hand with the VP, Customer & Business Strategy who is an experienced VP (7 years) and who places a focus on coaching and development.

What You'll Bring

Strong proficiency in SQL, Excel/G-Sheets, bonus if experience using Tableau
7-10 years professional experience in strategic consulting, marketing, analytics, or product management
Bachelor degree required; MBA preferred
Ability to identify untapped business opportunity and communicate analytics approach that generates significant customer or business impact
Proven ability to formulate hypotheses around category and business opportunities and a strong bias for proving or disproving those hypotheses
A catalyst and a change agent that champions innovative analytical approaches to business growth that generates durable advantage
Partner effectively with cross-functional teams, including Strategy, Marketing, Analytics, Product, Research, & Finance to translate business strategies and objectives into financial outcomes
Detail-oriented individual who can quickly and accurately comprehend, manipulate, and prepare complex models and analyses from large and complex datasets
A proactive can-do attitude, a self-starter who is comfortable working independently and with ambiguity in a fast-paced environment while managing multiple priorities simultaneously
Proven track record of communicating effectively, telling stories with data, instilling confidence, educating, and motivating multiple stakeholders at varying levels

How You Will Lead

Industry Performance/Share: Lead person responsible for tracking/forecasting industry and competitor share performance & actively engaging with senior leaders & partners to communicate that within the context of overall business performance.
Customer Strategy: Identifying growth and customer lifetime value opportunities through a deep understanding of acquisition & retention performance/drivers, customer segments, & forward-looking business models/monetization strategies
Value Pools/Target Segments: Using a combination of internal, public, and research data to continuously identify & evaluate opportunities across new and existing customer segments with the goal of influencing overall customer acquisition strategy.
Opportunity Sizing/Business Modeling: Evaluate strategic decisions and size new growth opportunities, collaborate across teams to develop business case and bring ideas to market
Competitive Intelligence: Develop a deep understanding of the industry, competitive offerings & their investor communications/materials to evaluate competitors’ strategy vs our own, bring the organization together through wargaming and scenario planning, and identify potential actions we would take as a result

The Center for Global Health at Weill Cornell Medicine seeks an enthusiastic and independent research analyst, with a minimum of Master’s level training in epidemiology and or biostatistics, with 2-3 years work experience, to join our team. Our research focuses on cardiovascular disease and infectious diseases in Haiti, Tanzania, and India. Our work includes studies in clinical epidemiology, clinical trials, and implementation science. The research analyst will report to Dr. Molly McNairy, Associate Professor of Medicine in the Weill Cornell Center for Global Health, and work with a team of research staff, students, fellows, and faculty in New York and at our international sites. The analyst will be responsible for preparing, developing and managing observational and clinical trial databases, developing and managing datasets, data analysis, quality assurance activities, and data visualization. The analyst will support these data activities for manuscripts, grant submissions, and programmatic needs. Ability to work independently, problem-solve data management issues, learn new data analytic skills, and communicate clearly is key.

Responsibilities

·      Under minimal supervision and in collaboration with clinicians and research faculty, conduct database and dataset design and management, including uploading and extracting data, cleaning large data sets with clinical, imaging, and laboratory data

·      Provide statistical expertise in analyzing data. Executes analytical plans using statistical software and report results to investigators and collaborators. Performs intermediate to expert level statistical queries, analyses, and evaluation. Includes: summary statistics, multivariable regression models, mixed effects models, survival curves, among others.

·      Verify data integrity and data quality assurance including logic checks, missing data reports, and communication of these data to the field teams

·      Organize and harmonize statistical code across multiple projects, create and manage github repository

·      Contributes to written sections for IRB applications, grant applications, and manuscripts for assigned projects

·      Data visualization of figures and images for data dissemination

·      Prepares reports for leadership that effectively communicates trends, patterns, and other relevant findings

·      Mentor and train students, research assistants and international colleague in data collection, management and analysis conjunction with Dr. McNairy

Requirements

·      Master's degree in epidemiology, biostatistics, health services research or a relevant field of study. Medical training is major plus.

·      Work experience and/or research experience in large-scale data management, data analyses, and data visualization is highly desirable. Ideally 2-3 years of prior work experience in research

·      Experience working on manuscripts, quantitative data analysis including inferential statistics

·      Complete proficiency in R.

·      Knowledge of appropriate statistical analysis for clinical research studies

·      Willingness to travel to international sites (approximately 1-3 trips per year, COVID allowing)

·      Very strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with a proven track record of working both independently and in teams

·      Excellent organizational skills for project management, time management skills and the ability to manage several concurrent tasks

·      Needs work authorization for the US (unfortunately Center for Global Health is not able to provide work sponsorship at this time)

Preferred qualifications

·      Research publication history (2 or more papers preferred, but abstract/posters will be accepted)

·      Previous experience supervising junior staff or students on research projects

·      Interest in global health and/or chronic disease research

Interested candidates please send your CV, a cover letter stating interests in global health research and career goals, and an example of a paper or academic writing to Nour Mourra (mnm4001@med.cornell.edu)

Job_title: Data & Reporting Analyst, Ronald McDonald House Charities
Job_description:
For nearly 50 years, Ronald McDonald House Charities (RMHC) has been working to improve the health and well-being of children-impacting millions of children and their families worldwide every year.



RMHC strives to be part of the solution to issues challenging families today. Families are challenged with how to stay near and support a hospitalized child; how to afford staying together in another city while a child is undergoing treatment; or even getting basic medical and dental care in underserved communities. We use our resources and partnerships in the community to help families gain access to health care services and keep families together during critical points in their children's lives.



Based out of our headquarters in the West Loop of Chicago, the RMHC Data & Reporting Analyst will support cross-functional RMHC initiatives by performing data analysis, providing strategic business insights, and reporting on McDonald’s and RMHC's National Fundraiser data to both internal and external stakeholders.



Responsibilities



Collaborate with the cross-functional RMHC Global team and McDonald's to provide guidance on financial infrastructure needed to implement new Global McDonald’s facilitated giving opportunities for RMHC
Work in partnership with the RMHC In-Restaurant Operations team and third-party Donation Box collection management company to collectively review financial performance metrics and evaluate financial policies and procedures to minimize financial risk
Review the U.S. McDonald’s monthly open store listing and align new McDonald’s Restaurants with Local Chapters as well as evaluate alignment as requested by RMHC U.S. Field Operations Team
Serve as the finance expert on all McDonald's National Fundraisers and perform the review, reconciliation, and reporting for all RMHC U.S. National Fundraisers, including U.S. RMHC Donation Boxes, Round-Up for RMHC, Fixed Donations, and the Every Day Happy Meal program. This includes working withMcDonald’s Global Business Services as necessary on reporting questions and designing/maintaining the RMHC Global and Local Chapter reporting related to RMHC U.S. National Fundraisers
Compile, review and analyze McDonald’s National Fundraiser revenue data to identify trends and opportunities
Provide support for regular and ad hoc data requests from various internal and external stakeholders, including but not limited to: RMHC Global team, McDonald’s (Corporate, Co-Ops, Field Offices, etc.), Owner/Operators and Chapters
Assist in National Fundraiser revenue and expense budgeting and evaluating longevity and sustainability of the programs


Qualifications



Must be fully vaccinated (i.e., at least 2 weeks after last dose) for COVID-19 and, if hired, present proof of vaccination by start date.

Company Summary

Etiometry is the market leader in predictive analytics for the Intensive Care Unit. Our system leverages

real time patient data to provide clinicians with actionable information that improves care for the most

vulnerable patients. In use at some of the best medical institutions across three continents, the

Etiometry Platform has a proven track record in improving patients’ outcomes while reducing hospital

costs.

By joining our company, you will be at the forefront of clinical innovation, working with a passionate

team of engineers with the common mission of changing the delivery of healthcare. You will become an

integral part of a dynamic team whose work will directly impact the long-term success of the company

and will provide great career development opportunities.

Position Summary

We are currently seeking a Data Engineer who will be responsible for storing application data and

generating reports that provide business and clinical insights. Your role will be to merge application data

from multiple sources into a database that can support robust reporting workflows. Additionally, you will

interface with report stakeholders to design new & improved reporting capabilities.

Responsibilities

·      Design, implement, and support a scalable database solution to store application data

·      Develop and support Etiometry's data-warehouse solution both for clinical personnel and internal research staff.

·      Produce and document production ready code for a clinical environment.

·      Build, test and deploy software and database upgrades into a clinical environment.

·      Interface with hospital IT staff to determine site specific platform configurations.

·      Use and improve Etiometry’s existing clinical data cleaning tools and techniques, which include data extraction and de-identification tools, and clinical measure normalization tools and methodologies.

·      Collaborate with internal researchers to design and implement data requirements for company research studies.

Basic Qualifications

·      BS in computer science, systems engineering, or a similar technical field with relevant work experience.

·      Strong understanding of CS fundamentals in software architecture, data structures, and algorithms.

·      4+ years of experience working with Python as a primary development language with an emphasis on data management and processing.

·      An understanding of data model design, database schemas, and optimizing database applications.

·      A breadth of understanding of database technologies including both relational and non-relational solutions.

·      Comfortable manipulating large data sets of time-series and intermittent data.

·      Comfortable developing and deploying software in a Unix based environment.

Desired Qualifications

·      An understanding of clinical (or any data-driven) research from a data aggregation and methodologies standpoint (study design, subject protections, and statistical analysis).

·      Experience producing software for a clinical setting that utilizes clinical patient data, e.g., labs, physiologic signals, and administrative data.

·      Experience with Agile software development methodologies, and continuous integration and delivery.

·      Experience with infrastructure and application security including encryption at rest and in transit and basic user authentication schemes.

Employee Benefits

·      Generous benefits package

·      Flexible Paid Time Off and major holidays off

·      Flexible hours with work from home capabilities

·      Incentive Stock Options

·      Bonus Program

Role: Team Lead- Big Data Senior Programmer




Location: Phoenix AZ (Hybrid)




Duration: 6-month contract to hire




General Job Description




The Principal Programmer/Technical Lead will provide technical leadership for assigned IT development personnel and be responsible for the technical design and implementation of mid-range software development of the assigned web services and/or applications. Key aspects which will differentiate this role are: possessing working knowledge of latest industry best practices and trends within data frameworks and management (e.g. SQL/non-SQL, In-memory Cache, SSD) cloud frameworks, content delivery network design, web services design, rules engine design, and software optimization techniques.




This position will work with product management, business analysts, developers, testers and architectural teams to define strategy and requirements, develop and drive high-level strategic initiatives, identifying and securing commitment from external and internal teams for new initiatives, driving consensus on the technical approach, setting timelines, and leading cross-functional crew application teams from design through delivery.




Job Qualifications




Minimum Qualifications - Education & Prior Job Experience




Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Technology, Information Systems (CIS/MIS), Engineering or related technical discipline, or equivalent experience/training
6 - 8 years of proven experience delivering enterprise software solutions as part of a team
Ability to influence others through outstanding interpersonal skills, collaboration, and negotiation skills
Ability to explain technical concepts and adjust message based on the audience, including non-technical groups
Self-starter, motivates others to do the same
Proficiency in coordinating across multiple teams to accomplish goals
6 years of Java development in a service-oriented architecture
3 years Application Programming Interface (API) framework / REST development
3 years in web services (mid-range) development




Preferred Qualifications - Education & Prior Job Experience




Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Technology, Information Systems (CIS/MIS), Engineering or related technical discipline, or equivalent experience/training
Experience delivering software to cloud environments - Azure, IBM Cloud, AWS, Google
Working knowledge of stream processing - Kafka, Spark
Deep knowledge of DevOps concepts
Experience with enterprise software security - PCI, PII
Web UI technologies - React, JavaScript frameworks
Mobile application development - Java/Android, React Native, iOS
2 years technical leadership of IT personnel
Airline experience a plus




Skills, Licenses & Certifications




Experience in Continuous Delivery/Continuous Integration (Jenkins, GitHub Actions, Nexus, TDD, Automated regression testing)
Experience with hw/sw resource management, cloud framework implementation, micro-services, and Apache frameworks
Experience in service optimizations for performance
Ability to take large, complex projects and break them down into manageable pieces, develop functional specifications, to be delivered in a successful and timely manner
Demonstrated experience leading large scale initiatives, and well-rounded technical background in current data management technologies




Proficiency And Demonstrated Experience In The Following Technologies




Java / JVM based technologies
Spring/J2EE
Data storage - SQL and/or NoSQL databases, ORM, caches
Messaging - pub/sub, p2p

Automated build/test/deployment tools




Working Knowledge In The Following Areas




Full stack development

GitHub




Essential Job Functions

Planet DDS is the leading provider of cloud-enabled dental software solutions serving over 10,000 practices in North America with over 60,000 users. The company delivers a complete platform of solutions for dental practices including Denticon Practice Management, Apteryx XVWeb Digital Imaging, Cloud 9 Practice Management, and Legwork Patient Relationship Management. Planet DDS is committed to creating value for its dental practice clients by solving the most urgent challenges facing today’s dental practices in North America.




This is a newly created role at the HQ of a fast paced, high growth SaaS business. Backed by Level Equity and Aquiline Capital Partners, Planet DDS has had a strong track record of both organic growth of its core product lines as well as successful acquisitions. As a newly created role within the company, this position will be instrumental in continuing this success by collaborating closely with our leadership team.




(This is a hybrid role out of our Newport Beach, CA office.)




What You’ll Do:

As a Business Analyst, you will work on complex data sets and provide strategic insights for decision making across the organization. You will be expected to drive analysis, lead problem-solving initiatives, and work closely with other cross functional teams under limited supervision. Your work will directly contribute to our overall business strategy and help drive its successful execution.

Own the design, development, automation, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions.
Analyzes complex business problems and issues using data from internal and external sources to provide insight to decision-makers.
Identifies and interprets trends and patterns in datasets to locate influences.
Will help define and then own/manage our analytics taxonomy.
Develop recommendations and strategic/tactical plans based on business data and market knowledge.
Creates specifications for reports and analysis based on business needs and required or available data elements.
Will provide consultation to users to address business issues.
Will directly produce datasets and reports for analysis using system reporting tools.




To be successful in this role you have:

3-5 years experience in a similar role, working cross-functionally with real-world, complex datasets.
Strong quantitative reasoning, aptitude for discussing business performance in terms of data points, and ability to quickly learn new business lines, technology enablers, and data sources.
Self-sufficient in gathering, normalizing, and analyzing data from multiple data sources to support ad-hoc reporting & analysis, intermediate level SQL skills required.
Working experience with Business Intelligence tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, Looker, Sisense, etc.
Experience with Salesforce and SFDC integrations.
Advanced skills on MS Excel and manual data management
Intuitive ability to understand what the data is "telling you" vs just reporting numbers
Attention to detail in verifying accuracy and reliability before broadly publishing dashboard updates and results.
Logical thinker that can organize business requirements into functional specifications for technical implementation.
Passion for learning and data analysis - Self-motivated and curious, asking clarifying questions to research issues, business needs, and underlying processes.
Excellent communication and PowerPoint skills to present insights, methodologies, and recommendations to executives and business stakeholders
Efficient and strong multi-tasker that can keep up and thrive in a fast paced, high performing organization.




Planet DDS Core Values

Collaborative

Working independently and across teams, we create scalable solutions to enable company growth.

Empathetic

We are educated on the experience of our customers and feel vested in their success.

Accountable

We feel ownership for the quality of our work and take pride in the positive outcomes.

Trustworthy

We operate with integrity and honesty, making promises we know that we can keep.

Ambitious

We are driven by our ability to make a long-term, positive impact on the lives of dental market leaders.

Job Title: Business Analyst - II

Business Analyst




This position will assume the role of a Business Analyst for the Product and Portfolio Management – Planisware implementation with the Client. The Business Analyst will seek out, develop, and help implement strategic initiatives for improved efficiency and productivity. This role will partner with cross-functional project teams in a matrix environment. The ideal candidate is a detailed planner, expert communicator, and a top-notch analyst. They should also have solid experience with translating business and technology requirements into a cohesive documentation as pre-requisite of development activities. This role will partner with global stakeholders, so the ability to work across different time zones is required.

Partner with stakeholders across functional business units to develop necessary analysis and documentation
Drive identification of requirements across business units and identify substandard systems processes through evaluation and real-time data

Author and update internal and external documentation, and formally initiate and deliver requirements and documentation
Partner with the Product Lead and Project Manager in managing and tracking the status of requirements throughout the project cycle; enforce and redefine as necessary
Partner with the development team for developing forward-thinking systems prototypes to promote increased efficiency and productivity
Perform, evaluate, and communicate thorough quality assurance at every stage of system development
Conduct daily systems analytics to maximize effectiveness and troubleshoot problems
Develop meaningful and lasting relationships with partners for optimized systems integration, and respond to questions and concerns from managers and executives with supporting research and recommendations

Excellent and proven analytical, critical thinking, and creative problem-solving skills
Excellent listening, interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills
Logical and efficient, with keen to attention to details
Practical experience generating process documentation and reports
Excellent communicator with the ability to translate data into actionable insights
Highly motivated and directed
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks while under pressure
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative and fast-pace environment
Demonstrated project management skills




Preferred Qualifications




Bachelor’s degree in IT or Computer Science
Knowledge of Planisware, is a plus
5+ years of proven experience business analysis and systems development capacity
Proven development experience of innovative and impactful systems solutions
Proven capabilities in project and user-testing management
Highly proficient technical writing capabilities

Imagine working for a business that serves customers’ best interests even when it costs the company. Imagine having coworkers who help you move, throw you a baby shower, and challenge you in video games. And imagine finishing each day satisfied by your work and appreciated because of it. All of that is reality at Circuit Board Medics. Our team strives to serve each other and serve our customers with passion, grit, and excellence. Right now we are searching for individuals to join us as we restore what’s broken for our customers.




What We Do




In a world that tends toward replacement, Circuit Board Medics recognizes the value of fixing what is broken. Founded in 2010, Circuit Board Medics (CBM) has cemented its place in the remanufacturing world through high quality work and stellar customer service. CBM specializes in repairing and rebuilding circuitry in automotive and appliance modules. By repairing these components, CBM offers customers an alternative to high cost replacement parts and a timely solution for malfunctioning ovens, refrigerators, cars, trucks and more.




Who We Want




Our employees embody our values. We take ownership for our work; we are curious, creative, and adaptable; we selflessly put the needs of others above our own. We treat others the way we want to be treated and we challenge each other so that, as iron sharpens iron, we each continue to grow and develop. The ideal CBM candidate has good judgment and is ready to learn. We are searching for those eager to contribute to the work and the culture of our company. In interviews, we evaluate competence and character.




Job Summary




Our IT Support Specialist will be a hands-on member of the Information Technology team who provides troubleshooting and support to end users in order to ensure the smooth operation of daily functions in various departments. This person will assist the IT Manager and serve as the initial contact for technical support requests from internal users, installs, maintains, and supports user hardware, software, networks, and printers. This position will also participate in IT projects (e.g., office relocation or expansion, server and networking infrastructure upgrades, etc.).




Responsibilities and Duties




Provide technical support to internal users.
Act as initial point of contact for technical assistance to onsite and remote employees.
Install and configure approved applications on client computers.
Provision new user accounts and workstations.
Perform scheduled systems maintenance and updates off hours.
Setup and support network peripherals, printers, switches, and other network devices.
Assemble, install, configure, repair and maintain computer hardware, peripherals, and components.
Administer data backup and replication.
Identify, document, and resolve persistent technical issues.
Monitor and respond to any detected antivirus threats.
Provide training to end users regarding any procedure changes or upgraded systems as needed.
Maintain documentation of system and network configuration in internal knowledgebase.
Working under the direction of the IT Manager, implement new IT related projects and make sure the projects are completed correctly and in a timely manner.
Maintain the integrity and continual operation of the local network including the wireless networks.
Perform other related duties as assigned.




Qualifications And Skills




Required Qualifications




A.S. degree and 2 years experience in PC Support/Network Administration or a minimum of 3 years experience and relevant certifications.
Excellent understanding of general and high level concepts of PC computing and networking.
Ability to accept constructive criticism from end users.
In-depth knowledge of Windows Desktop Operating Systems (Win10).
Proficient with Windows Server 2016+, Active Directory, and Group Policy.
Ability to communicate technical details to non-technical users.
Ability to prioritize workload.
Strong customer service and communication skills.




Desired Qualifications




Experience with Azure and/or AWS cloud services for IaaS/PaaS
CompTIA A+ Certification




Working Conditions




Circuit Board Medics was founded on a 1 day turnaround for standard repairs. This nurtures a fast-paced environment that requires a strong sense of urgency. The typical workday is 8:00AM - 5:00PM with a break for lunch. The daily responsibility of the IT team is to ensure that all assignments are completed timely, which means staying after 5:00PM some days.




Physical Requirements




Installing hardware requires a medium to high level of manual dexterity. The IT Support Specialist should be able to lift 50 lbs.




Benefits




Health Insurance
Paid time off
Paid sick leave
Paid holidays
Stable Hours
401(k) matching
Adoption benefits
Continuing education
Employee discount
Paid training
Opportunities for advancement
Financial planning resources
Professional development
Free healthy snacks
Casual dress code
Branded clothing allowance
Game nights
Social outings

Start by applying online through our website or Indeed. Include a link to your online portfolio on your resume or cover letter.
Complete two assessments emailed to you with “Circuit Board Medics Application” in the subject line. (You will receive the second email after completing the first assessment.) Please allow up to 30 minutes to complete both assessments.
Our talent team reviews each completed application within 3 business days. If we are interested in moving forward with your application, you will receive a phone call within 1 week of your completed assessment date.




Need Help?




If you need any help along the way, you can reach us at hr@circuitboardmedics.com
